## Initiative: System Foundation & Core Infrastructure

### Epic: Offer Management & Support

#### Feature: Validate Offers Against Policy Business Rules
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: validate policy offers against business rules to ensure compliance and accuracy
- **Value**: I can ensure all policy offers meet regulatory and business requirements before processing

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **validate policy offers against business rules to ensure compliance and accuracy**,
So that **I can ensure all policy offers meet regulatory and business requirements before processing**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Offer Submission Intake**
User is able to submit policy offer data for validation processing

**2. Business Rules Engine Evaluation**
System automatically evaluates offers against configured policy business rules and regulatory constraints

**3. Validation Result Adjudication**
Upon completion of rule evaluation, system determines offer compliance status and identifies any rule violations

**4. Decision Notification**
System communicates validation outcome with details of any business rule failures requiring remediation


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Compliant Offer Validation**
Given a policy offer meets all business rules, When validation processing completes, Then system approves offer for further processing

**2. Non-Compliant Offer Rejection**
Given a policy offer violates business rules, When validation executes, Then system rejects offer and provides specific rule violation details

**3. Incomplete Data Handling**
Given required offer data is missing, When validation initiates, Then system prevents processing and identifies missing data requirements


**Reference URLs:**

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=585314119"
]

#### Feature: Derive Offer Values Through Automated Calculation Rules
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: automate offer value derivation using predefined calculation rules
- **Value**: ensure accurate, consistent pricing and terms are applied across all policy offerings without manual intervention

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **automate offer value derivation using predefined calculation rules**,
So that **ensure accurate, consistent pricing and terms are applied across all policy offerings without manual intervention**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Offer Derivation Initiation**
System triggers automated calculation when policy offer context is established

**2. Rule Engine Execution**
System applies predefined calculation rules to derive offer values based on policy parameters and customer data

**3. Value Computation & Validation**
System computes pricing, terms, and coverage amounts while validating against business constraints

**4. Offer Finalization**
Upon successful derivation, system generates complete offer package ready for presentation or underwriting review


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Successful Derivation**
Given Offer v2 is enabled, when policy context triggers derivation, then system calculates all offer values using active calculation rules

**2. Rule Application Accuracy**
Given valid policy parameters exist, when derivation executes, then computed values match expected rule outputs

**3. Incomplete Data Handling**
Given required data is missing, when derivation is attempted, then system prevents completion and identifies data gaps

**4. Audit Trail Creation**
Given derivation completes, when offer values are generated, then system records calculation metadata and applied rules

- **Action**: rebuild existing offers to reflect updated policy terms and conditions

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **rebuild existing offers to reflect updated policy terms and conditions**,

System identifies policy rule modifications requiring offer recalculation

#### Feature: Configure Offer v2 Domain Model and State Machine
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: establish hierarchical offer management architecture with state tracking capabilities
- **Value**: the system can systematically organize, reference, and monitor offer lifecycles across multiple policy contexts with proper entity relationships

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **establish hierarchical offer management architecture with state tracking capabilities**,
So that **the system can systematically organize, reference, and monitor offer lifecycles across multiple policy contexts with proper entity relationships**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Offer Portfolio Foundation Establishment**
System configures top-level container architecture (OffersHolder) to aggregate and organize offer collections across policy contexts with bidirectional entity references

**2. Offer Relationship Management**
System establishes linkages between offer holders and offer collections enabling navigation from parent containers to individual offer records and reverse lookup capabilities

**3. Offer Identity and State Configuration**
System assigns unique identifiers (behavior number, offer code) and initializes state tracking attributes (current indicator, state reference) for individual offer records

**4. Domain Model Validation**
System verifies all entities conform to base domain standards and relationship integrity constraints before enabling offer operations


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Hierarchical Structure Establishment**
Given the domain model is initialized, When the system configures offer entities, Then OffersHolder, Offers, and Offer entities are created with proper parent-child relationships and bidirectional references

**2. Entity Reference Integrity**
Given offer entities exist, When the system establishes relationships, Then OffersHolder links to Offers collections and Offers links back to OfferHolders without orphaned references

**3. Offer Identification Assignment**
Given an individual offer is created, When the system initializes the record, Then behavior number, offer code, current indicator, and state reference are assigned and retrievable

**4. Domain Compliance Validation**
Given entities are configured, When the system validates domain standards, Then all entities extend BaseType with proper annotations and pass integrity checks

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=618285687"

#### Feature: Enable Offer v2 Functionality Across Lines of Business
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: configure and enable standardized offer management capabilities across multiple insurance lines
- **Value**: products can leverage centralized premium calculation and offer lifecycle management without custom implementations

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **configure and enable standardized offer management capabilities across multiple insurance lines**,
So that **products can leverage centralized premium calculation and offer lifecycle management without custom implementations**


**Key Capabilities:**

**Offer Entity Foundation**
Establish domain model with policy offers as root entity and configure state machine transitions from data gathering to offered state.

**Premium Calculation Integration**
Integrate rating and prorating handlers with OpenL services registered in Zookeeper, supporting configurable service names for build, rebuild, and validation operations.

**Offer Lifecycle Management**
Configure listeners for offer rebuild, derivation, and validation with support for product-specific transformations when standard processing requires customization.

**Centralized Premium Storage**
Migrate from product-specific premium storage to unified premium bundle, consolidating premium data management across lines of business.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Offer State Transition**
Given domain model is configured, When build offers command executes, Then system transitions quote from dataGather to offered state.

**Premium Calculation Service**
Given OpenL services are registered, When rating request is submitted, Then system invokes configured service and returns premium calculation results.

**Product Transformation Support**
Given product requires custom logic, When standard transformation is insufficient, Then system applies product-specific transformations for rating and prorating requests.

**Centralized Storage Migration**
Given premium bundle is integrated, When offer is created, Then system stores premium data in centralized repository without product-specific storage dependencies.

#### Feature: Manage Offer Collections and Policy Holder Relationships
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: manage policy offer collections and maintain policyholder relationships through extensible offer storage
- **Value**: I can support evolving business requirements including offer versioning and multiple offer variations without system limitations

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **manage policy offer collections and maintain policyholder relationships through extensible offer storage**,
So that **I can support evolving business requirements including offer versioning and multiple offer variations without system limitations**


**Key Capabilities:**

**Policy Offer Storage & Retrieval**
User is able to associate offers with policies through standardized collection structure, enabling consistent offer management operations.

**Single Offer Management**
Upon initial implementation, system maintains one active offer element per policy for standard policy issuance workflows.

**Extensible Offer Collection**
When business requirements evolve, system supports expansion to accommodate multiple offer elements within the array structure.

**Offer Versioning Support**
If multiple versions of the same offer are needed, system architecture enables version tracking and historical offer preservation.

**Multi-Offer Scenario Handling**
When multiple offer variations require simultaneous management, system infrastructure supports parallel offer processing without structural changes.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Standard Offer Association**
Given a policy record exists, When an offer is created, Then the system stores the offer in the policy's offer collection and maintains the association.

**Single Offer Retrieval**
Given a policy contains one offer, When offer data is requested, Then the system returns the associated offer element with complete details.

**Collection Extensibility**
Given business requirements demand multiple offers, When additional offer elements are added, Then the system accommodates multiple offers without data structure modifications.

**Version Management Support**
Given an offer requires versioning, When a new version is created, Then the system maintains both versions within the collection structure.

**Cross-LOB Consistency**
Given offers span multiple lines of business, When offer operations are performed, Then the system applies consistent management logic regardless of LOB.

### Epic: Multi-Currency & Premium Calculation Support

#### Feature: Configure Multi-Currency Support for Insurance Products
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: configure and sell insurance products in multiple currencies
- **Value**: the organization can expand market reach by offering products denominated in customer-preferred currencies while maintaining operational consistency

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **configure and sell insurance products in multiple currencies**,
So that **the organization can expand market reach by offering products denominated in customer-preferred currencies while maintaining operational consistency**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Product Currency Configuration**
Administrator establishes currency support by configuring product data models, offer specifications, and rating dimensions to enable multi-currency operations.

**2. Quote Initiation with Currency Selection**
User initiates quote and selects applicable currency. System filters available packages and coverages based on currency eligibility rules.

**3. Premium Calculation Processing**
System processes premium computation through rating engines using selected currency as dimensional input, applying currency-specific business rules.

**4. Monetary Value Standardization**
System automatically denominates all monetary attributes and default values in the selected quote currency throughout the policy lifecycle.

**5. Currency Immutability Enforcement**
Upon quote creation, system locks currency selection to maintain data integrity across all subsequent policy transactions.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Currency Configuration Validation**
Given product requires multi-currency support, When administrator completes mandatory technical configurations, Then system enables currency selection for that product.

**2. Currency-Based Package Filtering**
Given user selects specific currency, When system retrieves available packages, Then only currency-eligible packages are presented.

**3. Premium Calculation Accuracy**
Given quote is created in non-USD currency, When system calculates premium, Then all monetary values reflect selected currency denomination.

**4. Currency Immutability Enforcement**
Given quote is finalized, When user attempts currency modification, Then system prevents changes and maintains original selection.

**5. Investment Flexibility Preservation**
Given policy currency is established, When investment options are presented, Then available funds are not restricted by policy currency denomination.


**Reference URLs:**

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=666806265"
]

#### Feature: Calculate Premium in Multiple Currencies with Rate Integration
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: configure and calculate premiums across multiple currencies using integrated exchange rates and currency-aware rating logic
- **Value**: the organization can expand market reach, serve international clients with localized currency options, and maintain accurate premium calculations aligned with regional financial requirements

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **configure and calculate premiums across multiple currencies using integrated exchange rates and currency-aware rating logic**,
So that **the organization can expand market reach, serve international clients with localized currency options, and maintain accurate premium calculations aligned with regional financial requirements**.


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Currency-Aware Quote Initialization**
User initiates quote creation and designates preferred transaction currency during product specification phase, establishing immutable currency context for the policy lifecycle.

**2. Currency-Dimension Configuration**
System applies currency as dimensional constraint across product offerings, automatically filtering available packages and coverages compatible with selected currency based on predefined currency-package relationships.

**3. Premium Calculation with Currency Integration**
System maps policy attributes including currency code to rating engine inputs, executes currency-specific premium calculations using OpenL rating logic, and applies configured exchange rates to monetary defaults.

**4. Multi-Currency Data Persistence**
Upon calculation completion, system stores premium amounts with associated currency codes and returns localized monetary values displaying appropriate currency symbols based on field-level currency context rather than global locale settings.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Currency Selection Enforcement**
Given a user initiates quote creation, When currency and state are selected during product specification, Then system filters packages to display only currency-compatible options and prevents modification of currency post-selection.

**2. Rating Engine Currency Integration**
Given currency code is configured as dimension and premium impact attribute, When policy data is submitted for rating, Then OpenL engine receives currency code as input parameter and calculates premiums using currency-specific rate tables.

**3. Monetary Default Currency Alignment**
Given offer configuration defines default monetary values (e.g., Benefit Amount 5000), When user selects non-USD currency (e.g., TWD), Then system displays defaults in selected currency (5000 TWD) without cross-currency conversion.

**4. Currency Immutability Validation**
Given a quote exists with assigned currency, When user attempts to modify currency after initial selection, Then system prevents currency change and maintains original currency throughout policy lifecycle.


**Reference URLs:**

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=666806265"
]

#### Feature: Map Premium Split Records to Product Attributes for Multi-Currency Processing
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: map premium split distribution attributes to product configurations for accurate multi-currency commission calculations
- **Value**: agency and sub-producer compensation is correctly allocated across currency jurisdictions and distribution channels

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **map premium split distribution attributes to product configurations for accurate multi-currency commission calculations**,
So that **agency and sub-producer compensation is correctly allocated across currency jurisdictions and distribution channels**.


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Premium Split to Product Mapping**
System maps broker agency identifiers from premium distribution records to corresponding product configuration attributes, establishing the relationship between commission recipients and product definitions.

**2. Sub-Producer Attribution**
System links sub-producer identifiers from split records to product agency hierarchies, enabling downstream commission calculations to recognize multi-tier distribution structures.

**3. Attribute Synchronization**
Upon policy activation or modification, system validates that all mapped attributes between premium split records and product configurations remain consistent for multi-currency processing integrity.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Successful Agency Mapping**
Given a premium split record contains broker agency information, When the system processes the policy, Then agency identifiers are accurately mapped to product configuration attributes without data loss.

**2. Sub-Producer Linkage**
Given multiple distribution tiers exist, When premium allocation occurs, Then sub-producer identifiers correctly reference product agency hierarchy for commission routing.

**3. Multi-Currency Consistency**
Given policies involve multiple currencies, When attribute mapping executes, Then all agency and sub-producer relationships maintain integrity across currency conversions and commission calculations.

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=527543999"

#### Feature: Maintain Currency Lookup Tables Across Product Lines
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: maintain currency lookup tables across product lines
- **Value**: I ensure accurate currency identification, localization, and historical data integrity for global policy operations

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **maintain currency lookup tables across product lines**,
So that **I ensure accurate currency identification, localization, and historical data integrity for global policy operations**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Currency Code Repository Management**
System maintains comprehensive ISO-compliant currency reference dataset with three-letter codes, sequential ordering, and country associations.

**2. Multi-Locale Currency Translation**
User is able to configure locale-specific currency representations across regions. Upon Malta locale selection, system applies regional prefix patterns; otherwise standard codes display.

**3. Multi-Territory Currency Mapping**
When currency serves multiple jurisdictions, system associates single currency code to multiple country codes for regional economic unions and shared currencies.

**4. Legacy Currency Retention**
System retains deprecated currency entries for historical policy data access and pre-transition transaction processing.

**5. Currency Lifecycle Support**
If temporal validity management required, system leverages effective and expiration dating infrastructure for currency retirement or adoption tracking.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Currency Repository Completeness**
Given global operations requirement, when currency reference data is queried, then system returns all 159 ISO-standard currency codes with country associations and locale translations.

**2. Locale-Specific Formatting**
Given user operates in Malta locale, when currency data is displayed, then system applies regional prefix pattern instead of standard codes.

**3. Multi-Territory Currency Resolution**
Given shared currency scenario, when currency lookup is performed, then system resolves all associated country codes for regional economic unions.

**4. Historical Data Access**
Given legacy currency transaction exists, when historical policy data is retrieved, then system successfully processes deprecated currency codes.

**5. Data Integrity Validation**
Given currency reference update, when data is submitted, then system prevents inconsistencies in ISO code structure and country mappings.

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=747871333"

#### Feature: Process Rate Guarantee Renewal with Currency-Aware Premium Recalculation
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: process rate guarantee renewals with multi-currency premium recalculation
- **Value**: guaranteed rates are honored while ensuring accurate premium calculations across different currencies and policy structures

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **process rate guarantee renewals with multi-currency premium recalculation**,
So that **guaranteed rates are honored while ensuring accurate premium calculations across different currencies and policy structures**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Rate Guarantee Renewal Initiation**
User is able to trigger renewal processing for policies under rate guarantee agreements, applicable to both master policies and member certificates.

**2. Multi-Currency Premium Recalculation**
System recalculates premiums honoring guaranteed rates while accounting for currency conversion factors and exchange rate impacts.

**3. Dual-Path Processing**
System processes master policy renewals and member certificate renewals through parallel workflows with consistent rate guarantee application.

**4. Rate Guarantee Validation**
Upon renewal submission, system validates rate guarantee eligibility, expiration dates, and applicable currency rules before finalizing calculations.

**5. Renewal Approval and Finalization**
System generates renewed policy terms with currency-adjusted premiums and routes for approval when thresholds are exceeded.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Valid Rate Guarantee Renewal**
Given an active policy with unexpired rate guarantee, When renewal is initiated, Then system successfully recalculates premiums honoring guaranteed rates across applicable currencies.

**2. Multi-Currency Calculation Accuracy**
Given policies denominated in different currencies, When rate guarantee renewal processes, Then system applies correct currency conversion and premium calculations per currency type.

**3. Master and Member Synchronization**
Given master policy with member certificates, When rate guarantee renewal executes, Then both master and member renewals process with consistent rate guarantee application.

**4. Expired Rate Guarantee Handling**
Given expired rate guarantee period, When renewal is attempted, Then system prevents rate guarantee application and applies standard renewal rates.

**5. Incomplete Renewal Data**
Given missing required renewal information, When submission is attempted, Then system prevents processing until all necessary data is provided.

#### Feature: Execute policy-controlled questionnaire attribute mapping for underwriting data collection
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: execute automated policy data extraction and transformation for underwriting questionnaires
- **Value**: underwriting teams receive accurate, policy-specific information without manual data entry or system coupling

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **execute automated policy data extraction and transformation for underwriting questionnaires**,
So that **underwriting teams receive accurate, policy-specific information without manual data entry or system coupling**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Policy Entity Resolution**
System retrieves policy URI from questionnaire root entity and resolves the associated Policy entity using entity linking services.

**2. Transformation Model Discovery**
System identifies and retrieves the appropriate transformation model for the policy type using external transformation concepts.

**3. Data Mapping Execution**
System invokes transformation on policy entity to generate structured JSON output containing policy summary, transaction details, and insured information.

**4. Insured Details Aggregation**
System compiles insured array with role designation, demographics, and concatenated name attributes from referenced party records.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Successful Policy Data Retrieval**
Given a valid policy URI exists in questionnaire attributes, When the system resolves the policy entity, Then policy summary and transaction details are successfully extracted.

**2. Transformation Model Application**
Given a transformation model is defined for the policy type, When the system applies the model, Then output JSON conforms to Policy-Questionnaire mapping specification.

**3. Complete Insured Information Mapping**
Given policy contains insured party references, When transformation executes, Then all insured demographics (role, gender, age, name) are populated in the output array.

**4. Handling Missing Policy Reference**
Given policy URI is invalid or missing, When resolution is attempted, Then system prevents questionnaire processing and returns appropriate error state.

### Epic: Policy Capabilities Catalog & Reference Implementation

#### Feature: Manage cascading policy changes across master and member records
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: retry failed cascading processes to synchronize master policy changes to member records
- **Value**: master policy updates are reliably propagated across all member policies without manual intervention

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **retry failed cascading processes to synchronize master policy changes to member records**,
So that **master policy updates are reliably propagated across all member policies without manual intervention**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Identify Failed Cascading Transactions**
System retrieves member quote/record revisions with failed or missing cascading flags and identifies the source master policy revision causing the failure.

**2. Prepare Member Record for Retry**
When member record is processed, system removes auto-generated quotes created during failed cascading attempts; clears all failed cascading flags from member revisions.

**3. Execute Cascading Retry**
System re-applies master policy changes to target member quote or record using automated cascading logic.
    3.1 Upon successful completion, system triggers cascading completion notification.
    3.2 If retry fails, system flags record for manual conflict resolution and quote issuance.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Failed Transaction Detection**
Given member records exist with failed or missing cascading flags, When retry process is invoked, Then system identifies all affected revisions and their source master policy transactions.

**2. Selective Retry Execution**
Given multiple failed transactions exist for a member record, When retry is triggered, Then system processes one transaction per invocation and preserves other failed transactions for subsequent retries.

**3. Cleanup of Failed Artifacts**
Given member record has auto-generated quotes from failed cascading, When retry begins, Then system removes those quotes and clears failed flags before re-cascading.

**4. Failure State Management**
Given cascading retry fails again, When processing completes, Then system flags the record for manual intervention and prevents further automatic retry attempts.

#### Feature: Evaluate policy eligibility based on term and maturity status
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: evaluate policy eligibility based on non-forfeiture option classification
- **Value**: I can accurately identify Extended Term policies to apply appropriate processing rules and benefits

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **evaluate policy eligibility based on non-forfeiture option classification**,
So that **I can accurately identify Extended Term policies to apply appropriate processing rules and benefits**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Policy Non-Forfeiture Assessment**
System evaluates the non-forfeiture option attribute of the submitted policy to determine eligibility classification.

**2. Extended Term Classification Logic**
When non-forfeiture option equals 'ExtendedTerm', system classifies policy as Extended Term and returns positive confirmation.

**3. Alternative Classification Handling**
Upon detection of any non-forfeiture option value other than 'ExtendedTerm', system returns negative classification result.

**4. Classification Result Output**
System provides boolean indicator for downstream policy processing and benefit application workflows.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Extended Term Policy Identification**
Given a policy with non-forfeiture option set to 'ExtendedTerm', when classification is executed, then system returns true indicating Extended Term status.

**2. Non-Extended Term Policy Identification**
Given a policy with non-forfeiture option set to any value other than 'ExtendedTerm', when classification is executed, then system returns false.

**3. Valid Policy Data Requirement**
Given incomplete or missing non-forfeiture option data, when classification is attempted, then system prevents processing until valid policy data is provided.

**4. Classification Result Consistency**
Given identical policy data, when classification is executed multiple times, then system returns consistent boolean results.

#### Feature: Retry cascading process execution at master policy level
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: retry failed cascading processes for master policy and all associated member records
- **Value**: master policy changes are successfully propagated to member records without manual intervention after technical failures

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **retry failed cascading processes for master policy and all associated member records**,
So that **master policy changes are successfully propagated to member records without manual intervention after technical failures**.


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Initiate Cascading Retry Process**
User is able to trigger retry cascading process for a master policy revision, specifying operation mode (Normal or Repair) via forceSuspention parameter.

**2. Validate and Identify Eligible Records**
System validates cascading applicability for the master policy revision and identifies all associated member quotes and records requiring retry processing.

**3. Execute Normal Mode Recovery**
When forceSuspention is FALSE or undefined, system removes failed cascading flags and re-executes cascading flow for each member quote/record, propagating master policy changes.
    3.1 Upon successful cascading, system triggers retry cascading business activity monitoring event.
    3.2 Upon failure, system continues processing remaining records without halting entire operation.

**4. Execute Repair Mode Cleanup**
When forceSuspention is TRUE for amendment or rate guarantee renewal transactions, system removes quotes created by failed cascading and suspends affected member records for future processing.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Cascading Retry Successfully Initiated**
Given a master policy with previously failed cascading, When the administrator triggers retry process with valid parameters, Then system validates request and begins processing all eligible member quotes and records.

**2. Normal Mode Propagates Changes**
Given forceSuspention is FALSE, When system processes each member record, Then failed cascading flags are removed and master policy changes are re-applied to member quotes/records successfully.

**3. Repair Mode Enforces Transaction Type Validation**
Given forceSuspention is TRUE, When master policy transaction type is not amendment or rate guarantee renewal, Then system returns error preventing suspension activation.

**4. Repair Mode Suspends Failed Records**
Given forceSuspention is TRUE for valid transaction types, When system processes member records with failed cascading, Then orphaned quotes are removed and member records are suspended for subsequent cascading inclusion.

**5. Partial Failures Do Not Halt Processing**
Given multiple member records require retry, When cascading fails for individual records, Then system continues processing remaining records and completes overall operation.

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=570112656"
]

**Status Update Completion**
Given approved reduced paid-up selection, When transition executes, Then policy status updates, premium billing ceases, and coverage adjusts accordingly.

**Regulatory Compliance**
Given any non-forfeiture transaction, When processing completes, Then system maintains audit trail meeting jurisdictional requirements.

#### Feature: Initiate cascading process on individual quote or policy records

**1. Event Detection & Routing**
System monitors master policy/quote transactions and identifies applicable cascading events based on transaction type (Amendment, Rewrite, Renewal, Cancellation, Reinstatement, BOR Transfer)

Upon master policy event, system invokes corresponding individual policy use cases (Cancel, Amend, Rewrite, Reinstate, Renew) with cascading replication and premium calculation

When master quote is issued or amended, system transitions individual quotes to appropriate target states (dataGather, issued, companyDeclined) preserving workflow integrity

Given master policy rewrite occurs, when cascading executes, then individual policies invoke rewrite use case and achieve issued target state

**4. Reinstatement Synchronization**
Given master policy is reinstated, when cascading completes, then all individual policies return to issued state and quotes resume dataGather state

**5. State Preservation**
Given BOR transfer on master policy, when cascading processes, then individual quotes maintain previous state (initiated/dataGather/premiumCalculated) without disruption

#### Feature: Track and report cascading process execution status
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: track and report cascading process execution status across master and individual policies
- **Value**: I can monitor cascading operations in real-time, identify manual intervention requirements, and ensure coordinated policy changes complete successfully

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **track and report cascading process execution status across master and individual policies**,
So that **I can monitor cascading operations in real-time, identify manual intervention requirements, and ensure coordinated policy changes complete successfully**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Initiation & Evaluation**
System evaluates each individual policy/quote for cascading applicability and assigns initial status (Accept for Cascading, Not Affected, or Suspended for ported members).

**2. Cascading Execution Monitoring**
System transitions statuses through lifecycle: Initiated  In Progress  Completed/Failed as operations (cancellation, amendment, rewrite, issue) execute.

**3. Manual Intervention Flagging**
When configured products require manual processing, system transitions status to Manual and prevents concurrent manual flags per policy.

**4. Error Recovery Management**
Upon failure, system enables retry (restart from initial state) or completion of specific operations (cancel, rescind, issue).

**5. Status Persistence**
System maintains current status per individual policy/quote without change history, supporting alternate paths for cancellation exceptions and ported member suspension.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Successful Cascading Completion**
Given individual policies accepted for cascading, When all operations complete without errors, Then system transitions status to Completed and updates individual entity states accordingly.

**2. Manual Intervention Detection**
Given product configured for manual cascading, When cancellation/OOS cancel transactions initiate, Then system transitions status to Manual and blocks concurrent manual flags on same policy.

**3. Error Recovery Path**
Given cascading operation in progress, When execution fails, Then system transitions to Failed status and enables retry to initial state or completion of partial operations.

**4. Ported Member Exclusion**
Given ported member records exist, When cascading amendment/cancellation initiates, Then system transitions status to Suspended and excludes records from cascading operations.

**5. Status Visibility**
Given cascading operations executing, When administrator requests status, Then system displays current lifecycle stage for each individual policy/quote without historical transitions.

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=448923062"

#### Feature: Execute Automated Aging and Anniversary Processing for Group Benefits
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: execute automated aging evaluation and transaction determination based on anniversary milestones
- **Value**: policies remain compliant with age-related termination rules and coverage adjustments occur automatically without manual intervention

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **execute automated aging evaluation and transaction determination based on anniversary milestones**,
So that **policies remain compliant with age-related termination rules and coverage adjustments occur automatically without manual intervention**


**Key Capabilities:**

**Attained Age Calculation**
System calculates attained age for all covered persons using anniversary date and person demographics upon scheduled batch processing.

**Termination Age Evaluation**
System determines if attained age meets or exceeds defined termination thresholds for each insured type classification (primary, spouse, child).

**Age Band Range Assessment**
When termination age not reached, system validates whether attained age remains within applicable age band range limits.

**Transaction Type Determination**
System assigns appropriate transaction (CANCELLATION for primary insured exceeding termination age, AMENDMENT for spouse/child aging out or age band changes, NO CHANGE otherwise) with prioritization logic.

**Effective Date Calculation**
System computes aging effective date aligned with master anniversary date for downstream transaction execution.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Primary Insured Termination Handling**
Given a primary insured reaches termination age, When aging evaluation executes, Then system assigns CANCELLATION transaction type with calculated effective date.

**2. Dependent Aging Out Processing**
Given spouse or child exceeds termination age, When aging evaluation executes, Then system assigns AMENDMENT transaction type preserving policy continuation.

**3. Age Band Adjustment Logic**
Given attained age exceeds age band range without reaching termination age, When evaluation completes, Then system triggers AMENDMENT for rate recalculation.

**4. No Action Required Path**
Given no age thresholds exceeded, When aging processing runs, Then system assigns NO CHANGE and bypasses transaction generation.

**5. Anniversary Date Synchronization**
Given anniversary milestone occurs, When effective date calculation executes, Then system aligns transaction timing with master policy anniversary.


**Reference URLs:**

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=570111888"
]

- **Value**: I can maintain data integrity and system performance by removing obsolete quotes while ensuring proper authorization controls

**Description:**

So that **I can maintain data integrity and system performance by removing obsolete quotes while ensuring proper authorization controls**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Authorization Verification**
System validates user possesses Policy Quote Delete permission before enabling termination actions across all lines of business

**2. Lifecycle State Assessment**
System identifies current quote status and routes deletion request to appropriate processing workflow
    2.1 When quote is pended, system executes pended-specific deletion workflow
    2.2 When quote is archived, system processes deletion via REST API endpoint

**3. Termination Execution**
User is able to initiate and complete quote removal from policy subsystem through designated interface or API

**4. Lifecycle Closure**
Upon successful deletion, system terminates quote lifecycle state and removes record from active inventory


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Permission Enforcement**
Given user lacks Policy Quote Delete permission, When deletion is attempted, Then system denies access and prevents termination action

**2. Pended Quote Deletion**

**3. Archived Quote Deletion**
Given quote exists in archived status, When deletion request is submitted, Then system processes via REST API and confirms removal

**4. Lifecycle Termination**
Given quote deletion completes successfully, When system processes removal, Then quote lifecycle state is terminated and record is eliminated from subsystem

#### Feature: Process Aging Amendments and Apply Age-Based Coverage Changes
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: automatically process age-related policy changes and remove ineligible insureds based on age limits
- **Value**: coverage remains compliant with product rules and age-based termination criteria are consistently enforced

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **automatically process age-related policy changes and remove ineligible insureds based on age limits**,
So that **coverage remains compliant with product rules and age-based termination criteria are consistently enforced**


**Key Capabilities:**

**Age Calculation and Eligibility Assessment**
System calculates attained age for all persons on the policy and determines termination eligibility based on product-specific age limits and termination dates.

**Insured Categorization and Filtering**
System categorizes persons by type (Primary Insured, Spouse, Child) and evaluates termination dates, retaining Primary Insured and exempt individuals.

**Coverage Dependency Evaluation**
When multiple coverages exist, system evaluates cross-coverage dependencies before executing removal to prevent orphaned relationships.

**Insured and Coverage Updates**
System updates insured information and coverages according to product requirements, removing insured records only when no active coverage associations remain.

**Beneficiary Association Validation**
Upon person removal, system validates beneficiary associations and retains person information if individual serves as beneficiary on any coverage.

**Policy Data Structure Reconciliation**
System removes terminated person data structures from policy entities and updates tier configurations to reflect current insured population.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Successful Age-Based Termination**
Given a child insured reaches maximum age limit, when aging amendment processes, then system removes child from coverage and updates policy structure if no other coverage associations exist.

**Primary Insured Protection**
Given aging amendment executes, when evaluating termination candidates, then system always retains Primary Insured regardless of age or termination date criteria.

**Multi-Coverage Dependency Handling**
Given insured is associated with multiple coverages, when one coverage terminates, then system retains insured record until all coverage associations are removed.

**Beneficiary Relationship Preservation**
Given a terminated insured serves as beneficiary on active coverage, when person removal evaluates, then system prevents person information deletion and maintains beneficiary relationship.

**Incomplete Data Handling**
Given missing birth date or termination age criteria, when aging amendment processes, then system prevents submission and flags policy for manual review.

**Cross-Coverage Termination Evaluation**
Given GTL child coverage with interdependencies, when Primary Insured age affects child coverage eligibility, then system evaluates both relationships before executing removal.

#### Feature: Orchestrate Aging Saga Workflows and Coordinate Multi-Step Aging Processes
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: orchestrate automated aging workflows to maintain policy lifecycle compliance based on age-related milestones
- **Value**: policies remain compliant with age-based rules, coverage adjustments occur automatically, and administrative overhead is reduced

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **orchestrate automated aging workflows to maintain policy lifecycle compliance based on age-related milestones**,
So that **policies remain compliant with age-based rules, coverage adjustments occur automatically, and administrative overhead is reduced**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Aging Process Initiation and Policy State Assessment**
System triggers aging workflow for target entity, loads policy data and existing aging flags, evaluates policy conditions through transformation logic to determine appropriate strategy.

**2. No-Change Age Tracking Updates**
When policy requires only age tracking, system updates attained age in aging flag and resets tracking metadata without modifying coverage.

**3. Amendment-Based Coverage Adjustments**
Upon detecting overaged dependents, spouse termination, or age band changes, system initiates amendment process, removes ineligible members, recalculates premiums, and issues updated policy.
    3.1 If out-of-sequence transaction detected, system sets processing flag and initiates manual rollover instead of auto-issue.

**4. Policy Termination Processing**
When primary insured reaches termination age, system cancels member record, processes cancellation transaction, and removes aging flag.

**5. Premium Recalculation and Validation**
System ensures premium calculation succeeds before proceeding to policy issuance in amendment scenarios.

**6. Aging Flag Lifecycle Management**
System maintains aging flags throughout process, resetting upon completion or removing during termination workflows.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Strategy Selection Based on Policy Conditions**
Given a policy requires aging processing, When system evaluates policy state and age-related thresholds, Then appropriate strategy (no-change, amendment, or termination) is selected based on dependent ages, spouse status, and primary insured age band.

**2. Age Tracking Without Policy Modification**
Given policy conditions require no coverage changes, When aging process executes, Then system updates attained age in flag and resets tracking metadata without initiating amendments.

**3. Amendment Workflow for Coverage Changes**
Given overaged dependents or age band changes detected, When amendment strategy executes, Then system removes ineligible members, recalculates premiums successfully, and issues updated policy or flags out-of-sequence transactions for manual processing.

**4. Termination Upon Maximum Age Reached**
Given primary insured reaches termination age, When cancellation strategy executes, Then system cancels member record, processes cancellation transaction, and removes aging flag.

**5. Premium Calculation Prerequisite Enforcement**
Given amendment requires premium recalculation, When calculation fails, Then system prevents progression to policy issuance and handles exception appropriately.

**6. Out-of-Sequence Transaction Handling**
Given out-of-sequence condition detected during amendment, When system identifies manual processing requirement, Then system sets processing flag and initiates rollover instead of automatic issuance.


**Reference URLs:**

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=570111890"
]

User triggers single or bulk transfer between agents within same agency, across external agencies, or to new organizational structures. System validates user privileges for quote updates or policy modifications.

System verifies policy is not cancelled or expired on transfer effective date, checks transaction date falls within current term, and prevents transfers on policies with pending roll-on processes.

**3. Invalid Status Prevention**
Given policy is cancelled or expired, When transfer is attempted on effective date outside policy term, Then system blocks action and returns eligibility error.

**4. Future-Dated Transfer Execution**
Given pending change flag is set with future effective date, When renewal date arrives or specified date is reached, Then system automatically executes transfer and removes flag.

**5. Privilege Enforcement**
Given user lacks required privileges, When transfer action is attempted, Then system prevents submission and notifies user of insufficient authorization.

**Incomplete Rule Prevention**

#### Feature: Configure dimension-based decision tables for product packages and plans
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: configure hierarchical dimension structures across product packages and plans to enable context-aware decision logic
- **Value**: product rules automatically adapt to policy attributes like plan type, effective date, and jurisdiction without manual rule duplication

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **configure hierarchical dimension structures across product packages and plans to enable context-aware decision logic**,
So that **product rules automatically adapt to policy attributes like plan type, effective date, and jurisdiction without manual rule duplication**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Dimension Root Definition**
User is able to establish dimension control containers at each product hierarchy level (Policy, Package, Risk Item, Coverage) to anchor decision context.

**2. Dimension Attribute Assignment**
User is able to designate business attributes as dimensions with permissible values to control rule applicability.

**3. Hierarchical Dimension Resolution**
Upon dimension retrieval, system evaluates child entities first; when child dimension is undefined, system cascades to inherit values from parent root dimension.

**4. Entity-Specific Validation**
System validates each hierarchy level independently using its relative dimension context to ensure rule partitioning integrity.

**5. Cross-Reference Governance**
System enforces that rules at parent levels cannot reference child entities; child rules may reference parent entities to maintain architectural integrity.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Dimension Inheritance Validation**
Given a risk item with no dimension values defined, When dimension resolution occurs, Then system inherits all dimension values from policy-level root dimension.

**2. Dimension Override Verification**
Given a risk item with explicit dimension values, When dimension resolution occurs, Then system applies overridden values while inheriting undefined dimensions from parent.

**3. Cross-Reference Restriction**
Given rules defined at policy level, When rule execution is triggered, Then system prevents cross-referencing child entities (risk items, coverages).

**4. Parent Reference Allowance**
Given rules defined at coverage level, When rule execution is triggered, Then system permits cross-referencing parent entities (policy, package).

**5. Multi-Level Validation**
Given dimensions configured across hierarchy levels, When validation is invoked, Then system validates each sub-tree independently using its specific dimension set.

  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=234623690"

**2. Exclusion Rule Configuration**

**3. Regulatory Compliance Validation**

**4. Cross-Product Impact Analysis**

**5. Exclusion Documentation & Communication**

#### Feature: Apply Deductible Amounts to Coverage

So that **the system enforces risk-based underwriting rules and maintains accurate premium calculations**


**Key Capabilities:**

**Deductible Selection Management**
User is able to select collision deductible amounts from predefined values constrained by line-of-business configuration and state-specific rules.

**Risk-Based Validation Enforcement**
When vehicle odometer exceeds 200,000 miles and registration state is outside Texas, system enforces minimum $2,500 deductible threshold during selection.

**Premium Calculation Trigger**
Upon deductible amount confirmation, system automatically recalculates premium based on ratable field impact.

**Override Invalidation Control**
If user reduces deductible amount, system removes previously applied manual overrides and recalculates using standard underwriting rules.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Valid Deductible Selection**
Given standard risk vehicle, when user selects any configured deductible amount, then system accepts selection and triggers premium calculation.

**High-Risk Vehicle Restriction**
Given odometer reading above 200,000 miles in non-Texas state, when user attempts deductible below $2,500, then system prevents selection and enforces minimum threshold.

**Premium Recalculation**
Given deductible amount change, when user confirms selection, then system recalculates policy premium reflecting new risk level.

**Override Removal on Decrease**
Given existing manual override, when user decreases deductible amount, then system invalidates override and applies standard calculation rules.

#### Feature: Manage Policy Lifecycle State Transitions with Conditional Routing
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: manage policy and quote lifecycle transitions through defined business states with conditional routing
- **Value**: I ensure compliant progression from quotation through issuance, modifications, and archival while supporting business exceptions and rollback scenarios

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **manage policy and quote lifecycle transitions through defined business states with conditional routing**,
So that **I ensure compliant progression from quotation through issuance, modifications, and archival while supporting business exceptions and rollback scenarios**


**Key Capabilities:**

**Quote Progression Workflow**
User is able to advance quotes from initialization through data gathering, rating, proposal, binding, and purchase stages. Upon premium impact detection, system conditionally maintains or transitions rating state.

**Policy Modification Routing**
User is able to initiate endorsements, renewals, cancellations, and reinstatements. When non-premium bearing changes occur, system routes directly to rated state bypassing standard workflow.

**Exception and Rollback Handling**
User is able to suspend, decline, expire, or rollback transactions. If issuance fails, system maintains purchase-pending state enabling retry without data re-entry.

**Legacy and Archive Management**
User is able to archive completed transactions and manage legacy policy renewals. System restricts archived records to copy-only operations preserving historical integrity.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Successful Quote Issuance**
Given a rated quote, when user initiates binding and purchase, then system transitions through bound, purchase-pending, and issued states without data loss.

**Premium-Impact Conditional Routing**
Given data modifications during rated state, when premium impact is not detected, then system retains rated state without forcing re-rating workflow.

**Endorsement State Management**
Given an issued policy, when non-premium bearing endorsement is initiated, then system transitions directly to rated state bypassing data-gathering stage.

**Rollback Protection**
Given a purchase failure, when user initiates rollback, then system reverts to previous stable state with all business data intact for correction and resubmission.

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=302062076"

#### Feature: Execute Automated Underwriting Rules Based on Risk Attributes

Upon entry of manufacturing year, system validates temporal relationship with model year ensuring manufacturing date falls within acceptable underwriting thresholds (within one year of model year).

**3. Exception Handling**
When validation thresholds are violated, system prevents policy progression and triggers grandfather rule evaluation for duration, effective date, and eligibility reason.

**4. Data Persistence**
System persists validated vehicle attributes and establishes linkage with model specifications for downstream underwriting processes.

**3. Grandfather Rule Activation**
Given temporal validation fails, When exception conditions exist, Then system evaluates grandfather rules for duration, effective date, and reason.

**4. Successful Data Persistence**
Given all validations pass, When user submits vehicle details, Then system stores manufacturing year with linkage to model year attribute.

#### Feature: Apply Driving Violation Points and Suspension Rules
- **Role**: Policy Underwriter
- **Action**: classify driver violations and assign risk points to determine policy eligibility and pricing
- **Value**: insurance risk is accurately assessed and policies are priced appropriately based on standardized violation severity

**Description:**

As a **Policy Underwriter**,
I want to **classify driver violations and assign risk points to determine policy eligibility and pricing**,
So that **insurance risk is accurately assessed and policies are priced appropriately based on standardized violation severity**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Violation Intake and Code Retrieval**
Upon receiving driver violation information, system retrieves corresponding violation code from reference table to initiate classification process.

**2. Severity Classification and Point Assignment**
System categorizes violation into predefined severity levels: Reinstatement (0 points), Minor Violations/Minor Speeding (1 point), Major Speeding (2 points), Major Violations (3 points), or Suspension/DUI (5 points).

**3. Risk Impact Calculation**
System applies assigned point values to policy rating calculations, adjusting premium amounts and underwriting eligibility based on cumulative driver risk profile.

**4. Underwriting Decision Support**
When total violation points exceed defined thresholds, system triggers underwriting review or automated policy approval/denial workflows based on risk tolerance rules.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Violation Code Recognition**
Given a driver violation record is submitted, When system processes the violation, Then corresponding category and point value are retrieved from reference table.

**2. Point Assignment Accuracy**
Given violation severity is determined, When classification is complete, Then correct point value (0-5 scale) is assigned according to category rules.

**3. Premium Calculation Integration**
Given violation points are assigned, When rating calculation executes, Then premium adjustments reflect cumulative violation point impact on policy pricing.

**4. High-Risk Violation Handling**
Given a Suspension or DUI violation (5 points) is recorded, When underwriting rules are applied, Then system triggers appropriate policy review or automatic declination workflow.

**5. Data Integrity Validation**
Given violation data is incomplete or invalid, When system processes submission, Then policy rating is prevented until valid violation classification is established.

#### Feature: Support Last Day of Month Policy Effective Dates

So that **policy effective dates align with business rules and regulatory requirements for personal lines products**

**1. Backend Configuration Enablement**
Administrator establishes technical foundation by integrating feature toggle dependencies, extending product term entities with extended date attributes, and applying policy term modification listeners at quote initialization.

**2. Feature Toggle Management**
Administrator activates or deactivates include-last-day functionality per environment via feature toggle server, enabling runtime control without code deployment.
    2.1 When enabled: system calculates extended expiration as last day of term period
    2.2 When disabled: system retains standard next-day expiration calculation

**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Feature Toggle Activation**
Given include-last-day toggle is enabled for a product, When policy term spans 2024-01-01 to 2025-01-01, Then extended expiration date is calculated as 2024-12-31 (inclusive last day).

**2. Feature Toggle Deactivation**
Given include-last-day toggle is disabled, When policy term spans 2024-01-01 to 2025-01-01, Then expiration date remains 2025-01-01 (exclusive calculation).

**3. Presentation Consistency**
Given extended expiration date exists for a policy, When user accesses quote summary, transaction comparison, or consolidated view, Then system displays extended expiration date across all interfaces.

**4. Backend Calculation Integrity**
Given configuration changes are applied, When policy undergoes term calculations, Then backend business logic remains unchanged and extended date serves presentation purposes only.

**State Transition Validation**
Given entry point execution completes successfully, When all business rules pass, Then policy transitions to Issued state and transaction completes.

Given transaction does not meet preconditions, When target state is not Issued or command is not applicable, Then entry point does not trigger and transaction follows standard flow.

**3. Override Invalidation**
Given existing policy overrides, When new odometer reading exceeds previous value, Then system automatically removes all vehicle-related overrides and triggers reassessment.

Given odometer reading exceeds 200,000 for non-Texas vehicle, When collision coverage selected, Then system enforces minimum $2,500 deductible requirement.

**3. Multiple Configuration Handling**

#### Feature: Override applicability rules based on user authority and command context
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: configure and apply override controls for product applicability rules based on user authority levels and command contexts
- **Value**: default product offers can be adjusted appropriately while maintaining governance controls and approval workflows for unauthorized changes

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **configure and apply override controls for product applicability rules based on user authority levels and command contexts**,
So that **default product offers can be adjusted appropriately while maintaining governance controls and approval workflows for unauthorized changes**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Applicability Override Evaluation Initiation**
User initiates override request for applicability rules. System evaluates applicability type, command name, user authority level, and entity overridable flag setting.

**2. Authority-Based Override Processing**
When user has sufficient authority AND entity is overridable, system permits direct state change and processes override immediately.
    2.1 When user lacks authority BUT entity is overridable, system routes request to approval workflow.
    2.2 When entity is not overridable, system blocks override regardless of authority.

**3. Override Decision Execution**
System applies approved override to modify default offer per decision table rules and command context.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Authorized Direct Override**
Given user has sufficient authority and entity is marked overridable, When override is requested, Then system permits immediate state change without approval workflow.

**2. Unauthorized Override Requiring Approval**
Given user lacks sufficient authority but entity is overridable, When override is requested, Then system creates approval request and blocks direct change.

**3. Non-Overridable Entity Protection**
Given entity is not marked overridable, When any user requests override, Then system prevents modification regardless of authority level.

**4. Command-Specific Rule Application**
Given multiple commands with different override rules, When user requests override, Then system applies command-specific authority and overridable requirements per decision table.

- **Action**: configure payment term types with billing cycle durations and localized labels
- **Value**: the system can support flexible billing arrangements across commercial lines products with standardized and custom term options

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **configure payment term types with billing cycle durations and localized labels**,
So that **the system can support flexible billing arrangements across commercial lines products with standardized and custom term options**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Payment Term Type Configuration**
User is able to define standard payment term types (ANNUAL, BI_ANNUAL, QUARTERLY, MONTHLY) with predefined month durations that determine billing cycle calculations.

**2. Custom Term Flexibility**
When non-standard billing arrangements are required, user is able to configure CUSTOM term type without predefined duration constraints for specialized business needs.

**3. Localization Support**
User is able to associate localized labels for each payment term type across supported locales (US, GB, MT English, French Canadian, Japanese, Korean, Traditional Chinese) to ensure regional compliance.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Standard Term Processing**
Given predefined payment term types are configured, when billing cycle calculation is triggered, then system applies correct month duration (12, 6, 3, or 1 month) based on selected term type.

**2. Custom Term Handling**
Given CUSTOM term type is selected, when term configuration is initiated, then system permits variable duration definition without enforcing predefined month constraints.

**3. Multi-Locale Label Validation**
Given payment term types are configured, when accessing term definitions across different locales, then system displays appropriate localized labels for all seven supported language variants.

**4. Billing Cycle Calculation**
Given payment term duration is defined, when billing schedule is generated, then system correctly calculates billing cycles using noOfMonthsInTerm attribute.

#### Feature: Maintain geographic and organizational address type classifications
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: configure and maintain address type classifications with multi-language support and entity associations
- **Value**: the system ensures standardized, localized address categorization across commercial lines operations for diverse party types

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **configure and maintain address type classifications with multi-language support and entity associations**,
So that **the system ensures standardized, localized address categorization across commercial lines operations for diverse party types**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Address Type Code Definition**
User is able to establish standardized address type codes with unique identifiers, display sequencing, and lifecycle dates for commercial insurance operations.

**2. Multi-Language Label Configuration**
User is able to associate localized labels across seven supported locales to ensure regional compliance and user comprehension.

**3. Entity Type Association Management**
User is able to restrict address types by party classification (Organization/NonPerson, Individual/Person, or Universal) to enforce appropriate usage.

**4. Address Type Deprecation**
When an address type becomes obsolete, user is able to set expiration dates and transition to replacement codes without disrupting active policies.

**5. Classification Retrieval**
Upon party creation or modification, system filters available address types based on entity type associations and active effective dates.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Code Activation**
Given a new address type code is defined, When the effective date is reached, Then the system makes the code available for the associated entity types.

**2. Localization Enforcement**
Given address types support multiple locales, When a user accesses the system in a specific language, Then localized labels are displayed according to the configured locale.

**3. Entity Type Restriction**
Given an address type is restricted to NonPerson entities, When a Person party attempts to use it, Then the system prevents selection and offers only appropriate alternatives.

**4. Deprecation Handling**
Given an address type has an expiration date, When the date is reached, Then the system hides the type from new transactions while preserving historical references.

**5. Case Sensitivity**
Given address type codes are case-sensitive, When duplicate codes differ only by case, Then the system treats them as distinct entries with separate lifecycle management.

#### Feature: Configure garage activity types for commercial auto underwriting

- **Value**: the system can accurately classify automotive service businesses, support multilingual operations, and streamline underwriting decisions through consistent business type categorization

So that **the system can accurately classify automotive service businesses, support multilingual operations, and streamline underwriting decisions through consistent business type categorization**.

**Successful Business Type Assignment**

**Undefined Business Referral**
Given business type does not match any predefined category, When classification attempts, Then system assigns 'OTHER' code and routes case to underwriter for mandatory manual review.

**Classification Data Availability**
Given business type code is assigned, When underwriting or rating process initiates, Then assigned code is accessible for decision-making and calculation purposes.

#### Feature: Maintain US county and geographic location data for rating territories

User is able to maintain primary coverage for 58 California counties plus additional jurisdictions (New York, Salt Lake), totaling 60 county records available for rating territory assignment.

**2. Complete Multilingual Translation**
Given a county code is selected, when the user operates in any of 7 supported locales, then system displays the appropriate translated county name following locale-specific conventions.

**3. Localization Prefix Enforcement**
Given Maltese or Korean locale is active, when county names are displayed, then system applies 'MT+' or 'J0313xx+' prefix patterns respectively to all county translations.

**4. System-Wide Data Consistency**
Given county reference data is maintained, when any commercial lines product accesses geographic information, then system provides consistent county codes and translations across all application touchpoints.

#### Feature: Execute automated enrollment validation rules during policy creation
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: execute automated validation rules during enrollment transactions
- **Value**: enrollment data integrity is maintained and compliance requirements are met before policy creation

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **execute automated validation rules during enrollment transactions**,
So that **enrollment data integrity is maintained and compliance requirements are met before policy creation**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Transaction Entry Point Determination**
System routes enrollment transaction to appropriate validation entry point based on transaction type (New Business, Amendment, Cancellation, Termination, Reinstatement).

**2. Master Policy Data Verification**
System validates transaction attributes against master policy constraints including effective dates, state information, and plan configurations.

**3. Participant Information Validation**
System verifies insured and beneficiary information completeness based on transaction type requirements, including relationship configurations and contact details.

**4. Coverage Configuration Validation**
System evaluates plan selections, tier assignments, coverage participants against policy rules and insured relationships.

**5. Transaction-Specific Rule Application**
System applies comprehensive validation for New Business/Amendment transactions; applies minimal validation for Cancellation/Termination/Reinstatement transactions.

**6. Validation Result Processing**
System prevents transaction progression when mandatory attributes are missing or invalid; system accepts transaction when all applicable rules pass.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. New Business Validation Execution**
Given a New Business enrollment transaction, When the system executes validation, Then comprehensive rules are applied including effective dates, state information, insured details, employment data, beneficiary information, and coverage configurations.

**2. Amendment Validation Execution**
Given an Amendment transaction, When validation is triggered, Then modified rules are applied allowing optional state and enrollment type updates while validating new insureds and beneficiaries.

**3. Cancellation/Termination Validation Execution**
Given a Cancellation or Termination transaction, When validation executes, Then only transaction effective date is validated as mandatory.

**4. Master Policy Constraint Enforcement**
Given any enrollment transaction, When effective dates or plan configurations are provided, Then system validates they do not exceed master policy constraints.

**5. Relationship Configuration Validation**
Given insureds with assigned roles, When validation processes relationships, Then primary insured has 'Self' relationship, spouse has appropriate relationship, and only one primary/spouse exists.

**6. Incomplete Data Prevention**
Given missing mandatory attributes for the transaction type, When validation completes, Then system prevents submission and identifies incomplete data requirements.


**Reference URLs:**

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=664380002"
]

#### Feature: Execute entity applicability rules to control individual policy UI visibility
- **Role**: Policy Configurator
- **Action**: dynamically control entity visibility and requirements through attribute-driven applicability rules
- **Value**: the system automatically adapts the policy interface based on coverage selections and attribute values, ensuring relevant data collection and compliance

**Description:**

As a **Policy Configurator**,
I want to **dynamically control entity visibility and requirements through attribute-driven applicability rules**,
So that **the system automatically adapts the policy interface based on coverage selections and attribute values, ensuring relevant data collection and compliance**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Attribute Change Detection**
User modifies coverage selection, plan choice, or attribute values. System identifies if changed attribute has required annotations (@Dimension, @ExternalValidation, @OfferContext).

**2. Applicability Rule Evaluation**
Upon annotation detection, system invokes product-specific Offer Manager service with current quote context. Backend applies Entity Applicability settings from OpenL configuration.

**3. Coverage-Based Applicability**
When specific coverage is selected, designated entities transition to Mandatory or Hidden state per configuration rules.

**4. Attribute Value-Based Applicability**
When defined attribute reaches specific value, related entities become Mandatory or Hidden based on condition mappings.

**5. Combined Condition Processing**
If both coverage selection AND attribute value conditions are satisfied simultaneously, system applies compound applicability rules.

**6. Interface Adaptation**
System updates quote image, removes inapplicable entities, enforces mandatory requirements, and refreshes UI visibility accordingly.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Annotated Attribute Processing**
Given an attribute with @Dimension/@ExternalValidation/@OfferContext annotation, When user changes its value, Then system invokes Offer Manager backend service for applicability evaluation.

**2. Non-Annotated Attribute Handling**
Given an attribute without required annotations, When user modifies value, Then system returns unchanged quote image without backend request.

**3. Coverage-Driven Visibility**
Given STDBU coverage selection configured with entity hiding rules, When user selects coverage, Then system hides designated offset attributes from UI and quote image.

**4. Attribute Value-Driven Requirements**
Given 'Voluntary' contribution type selected, When applicability rules evaluate, Then STDMemberPaymentMode becomes Mandatory and STDSponsorPaymentMode becomes Hidden.

**5. Compound Condition Validation**
Given coverage selection and specific attribute value both required, When only one condition is met, Then applicability rule does not apply until both conditions are satisfied.

**6. Product-Specific Service Routing**
Given different product masters (STD/SMP/Leave), When applicability request is triggered, Then system routes to correct product-specific Offer Management endpoint.


**Reference URLs:**

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=467808432"
]
