**1. Specification Access Control**
User is able to claim exclusive editing rights for entity manager listener specifications through manual lock protocol to prevent concurrent modifications.

**2. Configuration Management**
User is able to retrieve, modify, and publish listener configuration specifications that define data synchronization rules for individual product entities.

**3. Version Conflict Resolution**
When save conflicts occur, system preserves all specification versions and enables manual merge validation. Upon detecting version discrepancies, user confirms proper lock protocol adherence before finalizing changes.

**4. Availability Release**
User is able to release specification lock status to enable subsequent configuration activities by other administrators.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Exclusive Access Enforcement**
Given specification is unlocked, When administrator claims lock, Then system records administrator identity and prevents concurrent edits.

**2. Configuration Persistence**
Given valid listener specifications are submitted, When administrator completes modifications, Then system preserves configuration for synchronization execution.

**3. Conflict Detection**
Given concurrent modification attempts occur, When save conflict is detected, Then system presents version comparison and prevents unintentional overwrite.

**4. Version Auditability**
Given multiple specification versions exist, When administrator reviews history, Then system displays complete modification timeline with contributor attribution.

**5. Lock Release Validation**
Given administrator completes editing, When lock is released, Then specification becomes available for subsequent configuration activities.

#### Feature: Process out-of-sequence policy amendments and retroactive transactions with automatic state reconciliation
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: process retroactive policy amendments and automatically reconcile policy states across affected versions
- **Value**: policy changes are accurately reflected across all dependent policy versions without manual intervention, reducing errors and processing time

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **process retroactive policy amendments and automatically reconcile policy states across affected versions**,
So that **policy changes are accurately reflected across all dependent policy versions without manual intervention, reducing errors and processing time**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Out-of-Sequence Amendment Initiation**
User is able to submit policy amendments that affect prior policy versions, triggering automatic Roll On process for state reconciliation across master and individual policies.

**2. Automatic State Reconciliation**
Upon amendment submission, system performs three-way comparison between affecting quote, affected policy, and current policy state to identify reconciliation requirements.

**3. Delta Calculation and Merge**
System calculates version differences and automatically merges changes from affecting amendments to affected policy versions while preserving non-comparable attributes.

**4. Manual Roll On Override**
When automatic reconciliation cannot resolve conflicts, user is able to manually retrieve deltas, review differences, and complete merge operations.

**5. Processing Stage Tracking**
System maintains processing stage flags throughout amendment lifecycle to coordinate multi-version reconciliation workflow.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Out-of-Sequence Amendment Acceptance**
Given an active policy version, when user submits an amendment affecting a prior policy period, then system accepts the amendment and initiates Roll On process.

**2. Automatic Reconciliation Execution**
Given an out-of-sequence amendment submission, when system detects affected downstream policy versions, then automatic state reconciliation executes without manual intervention for non-conflicting changes.

**3. Conflict Detection and Manual Routing**
Given conflicting changes between versions, when automatic reconciliation cannot resolve differences, then system routes to manual Roll On workflow with delta comparison available.

**4. State Synchronization Completion**
Given completed Roll On process, when reconciliation finalizes, then all affected policy versions reflect merged changes and processing stage flags are cleared.

**5. Non-Premium Bearing Amendment Support**
Given non-premium bearing amendment type, when processing out-of-sequence changes, then system completes reconciliation without triggering premium recalculation workflows.


**Reference URLs:**

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=470291143"
]

User initiates rule creation by selecting class and defining descriptive rule name. System retrieves configurable parameters from product configuration with defaults set to 'All'.

**2. Parameter Condition Configuration**
User specifies multi-select classification parameters (Employment Type, Pay Type, Work State) to define member population segments. Parameters default to 'All' supporting broad or narrow targeting.

**3. Eligibility Attribute Assignment**
User assigns non-rate bearing eligibility values (Minimum Hourly Requirement, Waiting Period Definition, Waiting Period Amount, Waiting Period Mode). System validates against product-defined min/max ranges and value lists.

**4. Cross-Policy Replication**
When individual quote requests master data, system retrieves matching eligibility attributes based on classification parameters and applies product-specific mapping to individual policy eligibility records.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Rule Creation Validation**
Given user attempts to configure classification rule, When rule contains rate-bearing attributes, Then system prevents submission and directs user to plan creation workflow.

**2. Parameter Matching Logic**
Given classification rule exists with specific Employment Type and Work State, When enrollment data matches all parameter conditions, Then system applies corresponding eligibility attributes to member coverage.

**3. Default Attribute Inheritance**
Given classification rule lacks specific eligibility values, When rule is saved, Then system inherits default values from plan definition and applies plan validation rules.

**4. Multi-State Rule Efficiency**
Given user configures Work State as multi-select parameter, When rule targets 10 states, Then system creates single rule instead of 10 separate rules.

**5. Master-to-Individual Replication**
Given individual quote replicates from master policy, When replication service executes, Then system retrieves eligibility attributes matching classification parameters and maps to individual quote structure.

]

**3. Status Consolidation Completeness**
Given existing override records and current eligibility results, When status resolution executes, Then system produces complete categorization across all five status classifications.

#### Feature: Validate Rule Override Status and Track Override Validity Duration
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: validate and track rule override validity as data changes occur during policy processing
- **Value**: business rules remain accurately enforced while approved exceptions continue to apply within their authorized scope and timeframe

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **validate and track rule override validity as data changes occur during policy processing**,
So that **business rules remain accurately enforced while approved exceptions continue to apply within their authorized scope and timeframe**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Override Status Verification**
When data is entered or modified, system validates business rules and determines if existing override facts apply based on field values, effective date ranges, and override status (OVERRIDDEN, PENDING, DENIED)

**2. Invalidation Strategy Application**
Upon value changes, system applies configured strategy: default invalidation on any change, or conditional invalidation only when values increase or decrease beyond override thresholds

**3. Temporal Validity Assessment**
System evaluates whether effective dates align with override fact entry date ranges; when mismatched, user is notified of rule violation and may establish new override if eligible

**4. Override Fact Lifecycle Management**
When entity removal occurs or values become compliant, system automatically removes associated override facts and resumes standard rule validation without manual intervention


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Valid Override Persistence**
Given an active override with matching field values and effective dates, When user modifies unrelated data, Then system maintains OVERRIDDEN status and suppresses rule violation messages

**2. Value Change Invalidation**
Given a default invalidation strategy, When field value changes from override fact value, Then system invalidates override and presents rule violation requiring new authorization

**3. Conditional Strategy Enforcement**
Given InvalidateOverrideOnValueIncrease strategy with stored value 100, When user decreases value to 80, Then system preserves override validity without triggering violation

**4. Temporal Boundary Enforcement**
Given an override effective from 01-Jan to 31-Dec, When user processes transaction dated following year, Then system invalidates override and enforces standard rule validation

**5. Entity Removal Cleanup**
Given an entity with associated override fact, When user removes that entity, Then system automatically deletes corresponding override fact entry

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=632627020"
]

#### Feature: Persist Rule Override Data During Policy Conversion and Mid-Term Transactions

User is able to submit rule override records from legacy system with original user identity, timestamp, and approval status preserved

**2. Validation and State Determination**
Upon receipt, system validates override data and determines target approval state (pending, overridden, or denied) based on legacy status

**3. State Transition Execution**
System transitions override entity from uninitialized to appropriate state while maintaining original modification timestamp
    3.1 When conversion properties include updatedOn value, system uses legacy timestamp
    3.2 When standard commands are used, system applies current timestamp automatically

Given pre-existing override lacks updatedOn value, When UI mapper constructs display data, Then system uses entity timestamp field without error

**5. Standard Operation Isolation**

#### Feature: Apply Default Values to Policy and Term Attributes During Quote Creation
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: automatically apply predefined business defaults to policy attributes during quote initiation
- **Value**: ensure data consistency, reduce manual entry errors, and accelerate quote processing with compliant baseline configurations

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **automatically apply predefined business defaults to policy attributes during quote initiation**,
So that **I ensure data consistency, reduce manual entry errors, and accelerate quote processing with compliant baseline configurations**.


**Key Capabilities:**

**Quote Initialization**
Upon quote creation request, system invokes default value rule engine to identify applicable policy and term attributes requiring baseline configuration.

**Rule Execution**
System applies business rules from OpenL Rules repository to populate policy attributes, term conditions, and coverage parameters based on product type and jurisdiction requirements.

**Attribute Assignment**
User is able to review auto-populated default values across policy structure, with system maintaining traceability to source rules.

**Exception Handling**
When conflicting rules or missing configurations are detected, system escalates for manual resolution while preserving partial defaults.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Successful Default Application**
Given a new quote request for a standard product, When the rating engine processes the request, Then all mandatory policy and term attributes are populated with current approved default values per business rules.

**Rule Traceability**
Given default values have been applied, When administrator reviews the quote, Then system displays source rule identifiers and version timestamps for audit compliance.

**Incomplete Rule Handling**
Given missing default rules for specific attributes, When quote creation is attempted, Then system prevents quote progression and notifies administrator of configuration gaps with specific attribute references.

#### Feature: Enforce Mandatory Field Validation at Policy Issuance

- **Action**: enforce mandatory data completeness requirements before finalizing policy issuance
- **Value**: policies are issued only with complete and compliant information, reducing downstream operational risks and regulatory non-compliance

So that **policies are issued only with complete and compliant information, reducing downstream operational risks and regulatory non-compliance**.


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Pre-Issuance Data Assessment**
System evaluates policy application against mandatory field requirements defined by product rules and regulatory standards.

**2. Validation Enforcement**
Upon detecting incomplete or missing critical information, system prevents policy finalization and issuance.
    2.1 System identifies specific data gaps requiring resolution
    2.2 User is able to review validation results before proceeding

**3. Issuance Authorization**
When all mandatory requirements are satisfied, system enables policy issuance workflow to proceed through final approval and activation stages.

**1. Completeness Check**

**4. Partial Data Scenario**
Given optional fields are empty, When mandatory fields are complete, Then system proceeds with issuance without blocking.

#### Feature: Validate Policy Term Boundaries and Transaction Dates
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: enforce transaction date boundaries within policy term periods
- **Value**: policy integrity is maintained and transactions comply with contractual term limits

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **enforce transaction date boundaries within policy term periods**,
So that **policy integrity is maintained and transactions comply with contractual term limits**.


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Transaction Date Validation Initiation**
When user initiates a cancellation transaction with a specified effective date, system automatically triggers term boundary validation against the policy's contractual period.

**2. Policy Term Boundary Assessment**
System verifies the transaction effective date falls between the policy term effective date and expiration date using non-overridable validation rules.

**3. Validation Outcome Processing**
Upon successful validation, system permits transaction continuation. If date falls outside boundaries, system prevents transaction progression and notifies user of term constraint violation requiring date correction.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Valid Transaction Date Acceptance**
Given a cancellation transaction with effective date within policy term boundaries, When validation executes, Then system permits transaction to proceed without errors.

**2. Out-of-Bounds Date Rejection**
Given a cancellation date before term effective date or after expiration date, When validation executes, Then system blocks transaction and returns term boundary violation notification.

**3. Null Date Exception Handling**
Given a cancellation transaction with null effective date, When validation executes, Then system bypasses term boundary validation without triggering errors.

#### Feature: Reset Policy Attributes During State Transitions
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: maintain data consistency across policy entities during state transitions and transaction processing
- **Value**: policy data integrity is preserved and business constraints are automatically enforced without manual intervention

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **maintain data consistency across policy entities during state transitions and transaction processing**,
So that **policy data integrity is preserved and business constraints are automatically enforced without manual intervention**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Synchronize Detached Entity Attributes**
When policy entity becomes detached, system automatically resets transaction effective dates, term dates, and state values to align with parent policy.

**2. Enforce Transaction-Based Date Controls**
When rate effective date is modified, system validates transaction type and resets value if transaction is not NEW_BUSINESS, RENEWAL, or permitted type.

**3. Align Transaction Effective Dates**
When processing new business, renewal, or rewrite transactions, system automatically synchronizes transaction effective date with term effective date.

**4. Maintain Term Boundary Integrity**
Upon term expiration or effective date changes in detached entities, system cascades parent policy term boundaries to child entities.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Detached Entity Synchronization**
Given a detached policy entity exists, When parent policy transaction effective date changes, Then system resets detached entity date to match parent value.

**2. Rate Date Transaction Validation**
Given a policy undergoing endorsement, When rate effective date is modified, Then system resets to previous version value if transaction type is not NEW_BUSINESS or RENEWAL.

**3. New Business Date Alignment**
Given a NEW_BUSINESS transaction, When transaction effective date differs from term effective date, Then system resets transaction effective date to term effective date.

**4. State Propagation Control**
Given a detached entity with non-deleted state, When parent policy state changes, Then system synchronizes detached entity state except when parent state is Deleted.

#### Feature: Manage Offer Invocation Points and Execution Phases
- **Role**: Policy Configurator
- **Action**: define and manage invocation points for decision tables within the policy processing lifecycle
- **Value**: the rules engine executes business logic at precise stages, ensuring accurate rating, underwriting, and lifecycle operations across product lines

So that **the rules engine executes business logic at precise stages, ensuring accurate rating, underwriting, and lifecycle operations across product lines**.


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Invocation Point Specification**
Configurator defines trigger locations within policy processing stages (e.g., quote, bind, renewal) where decision tables execute.

**2. Decision Table Association**
Configurator maps specific KRAKEN rules and decision tables to each invocation point, establishing execution sequence and dependencies.

**3. Configuration Persistence**
System stores invocation specifications in structured format (Excel-based configuration repository) with version history preservation.

**4. Concurrent Edit Management**
When multiple configurators access the file, system enforces name-based locking to prevent conflicts; all versions retained for rollback.

**5. Product Context Isolation**
Configurator scopes invocation points to product lines (e.g., Dental Master), ensuring rules execute only for applicable policies.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Valid Invocation Point Registration**
Given a policy processing stage exists, When configurator defines an invocation point with valid decision table reference, Then system persists the configuration and enables rules execution at that stage.

**2. Concurrent Modification Prevention**
Given a configurator has locked the configuration file, When another user attempts to edit, Then system prevents access until lock is released and preserves all version history.

**3. Product-Specific Execution Scope**
Given invocation points are configured for a product line, When a policy transaction occurs for that product, Then system executes only the associated decision tables without cross-product interference.

**4. Configuration Traceability**
Given configuration changes are made, When updates are saved, Then system maintains version lineage linked to implementation tickets for audit trail.

- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: execute premium calculation sequences for group life coverage
- **Value**: accurate multi-tier premiums are computed following product-specific business rules

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **execute premium calculation sequences for group life coverage**,
So that **accurate multi-tier premiums are computed following product-specific business rules**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Premium Calculation Initiation**
User is able to trigger premium computation for group life policies, with the system identifying applicable coverage tiers and enrolled members.

**2. Sequential Rule Processing**
Upon initiation, the rating engine processes business rules in defined sequence: base rates  demographic factors  coverage adjustments  volume discounts.

**3. Dependency Resolution**
When calculation steps have interdependencies, the system maintains referential integrity and recalculates downstream values if prerequisite factors change.

**4. Multi-Tier Aggregation**
The system aggregates individual certificate premiums to group-level totals while preserving calculation traceability across all tiers.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Successful Sequential Calculation**
Given a group life policy with multiple certificates, When premium calculation is triggered, Then the system processes all rating rules in correct sequence and produces valid tier-level and aggregate premiums.

**2. Dependency Handling**
Given interdependent calculation steps, When a prerequisite value changes, Then downstream calculations automatically recalculate maintaining consistency.

**3. Incomplete Data Prevention**
Given required rating factors are missing, When calculation is attempted, Then the system prevents processing and identifies missing prerequisites.

**4. Calculation Traceability**
Given completed premium computation, When results are reviewed, Then the system provides audit trail showing each sequential step and applied business rule.

  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=746134652"

#### Feature: Validate attribute ranges and mandatory field requirements
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: validate vehicle usage attributes against acceptable business parameters during policy issuance or modification
- **Value**: premium calculations are based on accurate, quality-controlled vehicle usage data within acceptable operational ranges

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **validate vehicle usage attributes against acceptable business parameters during policy issuance or modification**,
So that **premium calculations are based on accurate, quality-controlled vehicle usage data within acceptable operational ranges**.


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Vehicle Usage Data Submission**
User is able to provide vehicle usage details including weekly driving frequency as part of policy transaction processing.

**2. Attribute Range Validation Execution**
Upon receipt of vehicle usage attributes, system validates that days driven per week falls within acceptable range (0-7 days) when value is provided.
    2.1 When attribute value is null, validation is bypassed and processing continues
    2.2 When attribute value exceeds valid range, system blocks transaction and notifies user

**3. Validation Response Handling**
User is able to view non-overridable validation results and correct out-of-range values to proceed with policy transaction.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Valid Range Acceptance**
Given vehicle usage data is submitted, When days driven per week is between 0 and 7 inclusive, Then system accepts the value and continues premium calculation processing.

**2. Invalid Range Rejection**
Given vehicle usage data is submitted, When days driven per week is less than 0 or greater than 7, Then system prevents transaction completion and displays range violation notification without override capability.

**3. Null Value Bypass**
Given vehicle usage data is submitted, When days driven per week attribute is null, Then system bypasses validation rule execution and continues processing.

#### Feature: Enforce conditional mandatory field validation based on attribute values
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: enforce conditional mandatory validation on dependent attributes based on primary attribute selection
- **Value**: the system ensures data completeness and accuracy when specific business conditions require additional information, while maintaining flexibility through override capabilities for authorized users

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **enforce conditional mandatory validation on dependent attributes based on primary attribute selection**,
So that **the system ensures data completeness and accuracy when specific business conditions require additional information, while maintaining flexibility through override capabilities for authorized users**.


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Conditional Validation Trigger**
When the user selects a specific primary attribute value (e.g., activity type categorized as 'OTHER'), the system dynamically enforces mandatory validation on related dependent attributes that provide clarifying information.

**2. Validation Enforcement and Feedback**
Upon attempting to proceed without completing conditionally mandatory attributes, the system prevents submission and provides business-level notification indicating required information is missing.

**3. Authorization-Based Override Mechanism**
If business justification exists, authorized users are able to bypass conditional mandatory validations, allowing policy processing to continue despite incomplete dependent attribute data.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Standard Flow Validation**
Given the primary attribute is set to a standard value, When the user submits the policy information, Then the system allows progression without requiring dependent attribute completion.

**2. Conditional Mandatory Enforcement**
Given the primary attribute is set to a value requiring additional context, When the user attempts submission without completing dependent attributes, Then the system blocks progression and indicates required information.

**3. Override Capability**
Given an authorized user encounters conditional mandatory validation, When the user applies override authorization, Then the system permits policy processing without dependent attribute completion.

### Epic: Experience Rating & Rate Guarantee Management

#### Feature: Execute Rate Processing Strategies on Policy State Transitions
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: execute rate processing strategies upon policy state transitions
- **Value**: premium calculations reflect accurate experience rating and rate guarantee rules throughout the policy lifecycle

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **execute rate processing strategies upon policy state transitions**,
So that **premium calculations reflect accurate experience rating and rate guarantee rules throughout the policy lifecycle**.


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Rate Strategy Selection**
Upon policy state transition event, system identifies applicable rate processing strategy based on predefined decision rules and policy context.

**2. Experience Rating Evaluation**
System calculates experience modifications by analyzing claims history, loss ratios, and insured's risk profile against rating tables.

**3. Rate Guarantee Application**
When rate guarantee period is active, system locks base rates and applies only permitted adjustments per contractual terms.

**4. Premium Recalculation**
System executes rate processing strategy to compute updated premiums, applying experience factors and honoring rate guarantees.

**5. Audit Trail Creation**
System records strategy execution details, calculation inputs, and results for regulatory compliance and dispute resolution.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Strategy Activation**
Given a policy undergoes state transition, When the event triggers rate processing, Then the system selects the appropriate rating strategy based on transition type and policy attributes.

**2. Experience Factor Application**
Given experience rating data exists, When strategy executes, Then premiums reflect calculated experience modifications within configured thresholds.

**3. Rate Guarantee Enforcement**
Given an active rate guarantee period, When premium recalculation occurs, Then system prevents base rate changes while allowing permitted adjustments only.

**4. Calculation Integrity**
Given rate strategy execution completes, When results are generated, Then all rating factors and intermediary calculations are captured in audit logs.

**5. Failure Handling**
Given incomplete rating data or strategy conflicts, When processing cannot proceed, Then system prevents policy progression and alerts administrators with diagnostic information.

#### Feature: Copy Latest Rate Aggregate During Quote Lifecycle Transitions
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: copy the latest rate aggregate during quote lifecycle transitions
- **Value**: pricing calculations remain consistent and accurate across all policy stages without manual intervention

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **copy the latest rate aggregate during quote lifecycle transitions**,
So that **pricing calculations remain consistent and accurate across all policy stages without manual intervention**.


**Key Capabilities:**

**Rate Aggregate Identification**
System identifies the current active rate aggregate associated with the quote before any lifecycle transition occurs.

**Lifecycle Transition Detection**
Upon detecting quote status changes (e.g., draft to bound), system triggers the rate aggregate copy process automatically.

**Rate Data Synchronization**
System creates a snapshot of the latest rate aggregate and associates it with the new lifecycle stage, preserving calculation consistency.

**Concurrent Edit Protection**
When multiple users attempt simultaneous rate modifications, system enforces exclusive access control to prevent conflicting updates.
    3.1 If rate data is locked by another process, system queues the copy operation until lock release.

**Version Preservation**
System maintains historical rate aggregate versions for audit and rollback purposes throughout the policy lifecycle.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Successful Rate Copy on Transition**
Given a quote with an active rate aggregate, When the quote transitions to a new lifecycle stage, Then the system successfully copies the latest rate aggregate and associates it with the new stage without data loss.

**Concurrent Modification Prevention**
Given a rate aggregate copy operation in progress, When another user attempts to modify the same rate data, Then the system prevents concurrent edits and queues subsequent operations until the first completes.

**Version Conflict Resolution**
Given conflicting rate aggregate updates detected during transition, When the system identifies version mismatch, Then the system preserves all versions and alerts the administrator to resolve manually.

**Data Consistency Validation**
Given a completed rate aggregate copy, When the system validates the new stage data, Then all pricing calculation inputs match the source aggregate without deviation.

System retrieves product configuration to determine rate selection strategy based on 'isSingleRateType' flag.

**Multiple Rate Type Product Processing**

**Commission Integration**
Given latest rate aggregate identified, When transmission initiates, Then commission system receives complete rate data for calculation processing.

#### Feature: Apply premium overrides with authority-level eligibility checks

**Description:**

So that **ensure pricing exceptions are properly justified, authorized, and automatically recalculated across policy lifecycles**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Override Method Selection**
User is able to choose adjustment mechanism: percentage-based modification, flat monetary adjustment, or complete premium replacement based on pricing strategy requirements.

**2. Justification Documentation**
User is able to provide override rationale with standard reason codes and supplemental explanations when using non-standard justifications to maintain audit compliance.

**3. Temporal Scope Configuration**
User is able to define effective term windows by specifying start term and duration parameters. When start term is omitted, override applies for policy lifetime. When duration is unspecified, override continues indefinitely from start term.

**4. Hierarchical Propagation Control**
User is able to cascade adjustments to nested premium elements through propagation flag, ensuring consistent treatment across coverage structures.

**5. Authority Validation & Execution**
Upon submission, system validates user permissions against operation type requirements and automatically triggers premium recalculation across affected policy components.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Override Authorization Enforcement**
Given user attempts premium adjustment, When operation type requires specific permission, Then system validates authority level before allowing override creation, modification, or deletion.

Given user selects percentage override with valid percentage value, When override is submitted with required justification, Then system applies percentage adjustment and recalculates affected premiums automatically.

**3. Temporal Scope Validation**
Given user configures temporal parameters, When start term is omitted, Then override applies for entire policy lifecycle. When start term is specified without duration, Then override continues indefinitely from specified term forward.

**4. Supplemental Justification Requirement**
Given user selects 'Other' as override reason, When attempting to save override, Then system prevents submission if supplemental explanation is not provided.

**5. Hierarchical Propagation Execution**
Given propagation flag is enabled, When override is applied, Then system cascades adjustment to all nested premium elements and triggers comprehensive recalculation.

#### Feature: Process prorating adjustments for mid-term policy changes
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: process prorated premium adjustments for mid-term policy changes
- **Value**: accurate earned and unearned premium calculations reflect actual policy exposure periods and maintain financial compliance across all endorsement scenarios

**Description:**

As a Policy Administrator,
I want to process prorated premium adjustments for mid-term policy changes,
So that accurate earned and unearned premium calculations reflect actual policy exposure periods and maintain financial compliance across all endorsement scenarios


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Date-Specific Premium State Determination**
System identifies correct policy version based on calculation date and determines earned premium ranging from zero at effective date to full gross written premium at expiration

**2. Time-Based Proration Calculation**
System calculates earned and unearned portions using elapsed days, remaining days, and prorating factors, ensuring sum equals gross written premium without rounding discrepancies

**3. Standard Endorsement Processing**
When endorsement exists at calculation date, system applies updated premium data from effective policy version

**4. Future-Dated Endorsement Handling**
If calculation date precedes endorsement effective date, system uses current policy version and excludes pending changes

**5. Backdated and Out-of-Sequence Adjustment**
When period start date exceeds transaction effective date, system calculates compensating adjustments for earned premium differences

**6. Period Delta Calculation**
System computes earned premium change between start and end dates using respective policy versions at each point


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Baseline Proration Accuracy**
Given a policy between effective and expiration dates, when earned premium is calculated, then unearned premium plus earned premium equals gross written premium with zero rounding variance

**2. Version-Correct Calculation**
Given multiple endorsements exist, when calculating for specific date, then system uses policy version effective on that date regardless of future pending changes

**3. Future Endorsement Exclusion**
Given future-dated endorsement exists, when calculating earned premium before endorsement effective date, then calculation uses current policy version and excludes future changes

**4. Backdated Adjustment Generation**
Given backdated endorsement with period start after transaction effective date, when processing adjustment, then system calculates compensating earned premium delta for gap period

**5. Period Calculation Consistency**
Given period with start and end dates, when computing period earned premium, then delta equals end-date earned premium minus start-date earned premium using respective versions


**Reference URLs:**

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=208089532"
]

**3. Rule Application and Adjudication**
System processes premium calculations incorporating package-aware attributes, proration logic, and adjustment factors according to defined business rules.

**4. Calculation Result Generation**
Upon successful execution, system produces premium amounts reflecting package specifications and applicable adjustments.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Configuration Availability**
Given package-aware property rules are maintained in external Excel file, When calculation is initiated, Then system successfully accesses current configuration specifications.

**2. Accurate Premium Computation**
Given valid policy data and package configuration, When premium calculation executes, Then resulting premium reflects package-aware properties and business rules correctly.

**3. Configuration Dependency Handling**
Given Excel configuration is inaccessible or outdated, When calculation is attempted, Then system prevents execution and notifies administrator of configuration issue.

**4. Calculation Traceability**
Given premium calculation completes, When results are generated, Then system maintains audit trail linking calculated premium to applied package-aware property rules.

#### Feature: Calculate and load rates for master quotes with error handling
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: calculate and validate rates for master quotes with comprehensive error handling
- **Value**: premiums are accurately computed based on validated business rules, compensation structures, and experience data while preventing downstream errors through proactive validation

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **calculate and validate rates for master quotes with comprehensive error handling**,
So that **premiums are accurately computed based on validated business rules, compensation structures, and experience data while preventing downstream errors through proactive validation**


**Key Capabilities:**

**Business Rule & Data Validation**
System validates policy business rules, decision tables, and experience rating data against configured thresholds. Upon detection of violations, system prevents rating progression and surfaces specific error locations.

**Compensation Structure Verification**
System validates broker compensation data and premium split allocations. When invalid compensation contracts are detected, system notifies commission subsystem and blocks rate calculation.

**Participant Threshold Enforcement**
System confirms participant counts exceed minimum thresholds for no-census cases. If thresholds not met, system displays notification and prevents progression.

**Rate Engine Invocation**
Upon successful validation, system invokes product-specific rating decision tables and calculates rates via external rating endpoint.

**Premium Summary Display**
System presents calculated rates, premiums, participant counts, and volume metrics by class or demographic band based on rate format.

**Compensation Change Handling**
When compensation modifications occur, system resets premium calculations and enables recalculation to reflect updated compensation structures.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Validation Prevents Invalid Rating**
Given business rules or experience data contain errors, When user initiates rate calculation, Then system blocks rating, displays error count with field locations, and enables correction workflow.

**2. Compensation Validation Gates Premium Calculation**
Given broker compensation data fails validation, When system processes premium split, Then commission subsystem is notified, premium split storage is not updated, and rating is blocked until corrections applied.

**3. Participant Threshold Enforcement**
Given participant count sum equals zero for no-census cases, When validation executes, Then system prevents rating and displays threshold requirement notification.

**4. Successful Rate Calculation**
Given all validations pass, When system invokes rating engine, Then premiums and rates are calculated, saved to storage, and displayed in premium summary by appropriate demographic breakdown.

**5. Compensation Change Triggers Recalculation**
Given compensation data is modified after rating, When commission subsystem notifies policy system, Then premium summary is reset and recalculation is enabled.

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=397514061"
]

#### Feature: Execute premium sequence scenarios for individual health policies
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: execute premium sequence scenarios across policy lifecycle transactions
- **Value**: accurate premium calculations and producer assignments are maintained throughout policy changes

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **execute premium sequence scenarios across policy lifecycle transactions**,
So that **accurate premium calculations and producer assignments are maintained throughout policy changes**.


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. New Business & Rewrite Premium Initiation**
User is able to establish initial premium sequences with transaction premium amounts, setting effective dates aligned to policy transaction dates and clearing producer assignments.

**2. Amendment Premium Adjustment Processing**
Upon policy amendments with returned premium, system adjusts existing sequences by reducing amounts from maximum effective date sequences until full return is processed. When added premium occurs, system either updates maximum effective date sequence or creates new sequence based on tier changes.

**3. Non-Premium Business Adjustment Handling**
User is able to process producer updates and non-premium amendments by copying existing sequences, resetting premium changes to zero while maintaining amounts and effective dates.

**4. Cancellation Premium Reversal**
When cancellation occurs, system reverses premium by setting changes to negative amounts and resetting sequence amounts to zero.

**5. Reinstatement Premium Restoration**
User is able to restore premiums to pre-cancellation values by retrieving amounts from cancelled revision and updating sequences accordingly.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. New Business Premium Sequence Creation**
Given a new business transaction with added premium, When policy is issued, Then system creates new premium sequence with premium change and amount equal to transaction premium, effective dates set to transaction date, and producer assignment cleared.

**2. Returned Premium Distribution**
Given an amendment with returned premium exceeding single sequence amount, When adjustment is processed, Then system distributes return across multiple sequences starting from maximum effective date until full amount is reduced, excluding zero-amount sequences.

**3. Added Premium Allocation**
Given amendment with added premium and tier change, When transaction is processed, Then system creates new premium sequence for tier changes or updates maximum effective date sequence for other changes.

**4. Cancellation Reversal Accuracy**
Given active policy with existing premium sequences, When cancellation is executed, Then system reverses all non-zero sequences by negating premium changes and resetting amounts to zero.

**5. Reinstatement Data Integrity**
Given cancelled policy, When reinstatement is processed, Then system restores premium sequences from pre-cancellation state with original amounts and updates transaction effective dates.

#### Feature: Execute renewal rating jobs to automatically recalculate premiums at policy renewal
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: execute automated renewal rating jobs to recalculate premiums at policy renewal
- **Value**: policies are renewed with accurate premiums without manual intervention, reducing processing time and errors

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **execute automated renewal rating jobs to recalculate premiums at policy renewal**,
So that **policies are renewed with accurate premiums without manual intervention, reducing processing time and errors**


**Key Capabilities:**

**Renewal Batch Initialization**
System initiates renewal rating process, validates eligible policy inventory based on automated processing strategy parameters (renewal date range, policy values, strategy rules), and logs process commencement.

**Sequential Policy Processing**
System iterates through policy list, acquiring policy locks to prevent concurrent modifications. Upon successful lock, system retrieves associated quote requiring automatic processing in Data Gather status.

**Premium Calculation Execution**
System executes configurable before-actions, validates rate policy strategy rule, invokes business rules and decision tables validation, then triggers rating engine to calculate premiums. If rate policy rule indicates 'No', system copies premium from parent policy.

**Premium Validation & Commitment**
System validates calculated premiums are positive and non-zero at all policy levels, updates quote status to 'Rated', executes after-actions, commits transaction, and creates business activity monitoring event.

**Exception Handling**
When errors occur (locked policies, validation failures, calculation errors, negative premiums), system logs exceptions, rolls back transactions for affected policies, releases locks, and continues processing remaining policies.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Successful Batch Processing**
Given eligible renewal policies exist matching strategy criteria, When renewal rating job executes, Then system processes all policies sequentially, calculates premiums, updates quotes to 'Rated' status, and logs completion without manual intervention.

**Premium Validation Enforcement**
Given rating engine calculates premiums, When any premium holder returns zero, negative, or null premium values at any policy level, Then system rejects the rating, logs the policy as exception, rolls back transaction, and proceeds to next policy.

**Business Rules Compliance**
Given configured product decision tables and business rules exist, When system validates rules during rating, Then all validations must pass before premium calculation proceeds, otherwise policy is logged as exception and transaction is rolled back.

**Concurrent Access Protection**
Given another process has locked a policy, When renewal rating job attempts to process that policy, Then system logs the policy as exception without disrupting the batch, and continues processing remaining policies.

**Strategy-Based Rate Bypass**
Given 'Rate policy?' strategy rule is set to 'No', When system evaluates rating requirement, Then premium is copied from parent policy, quote status updates to 'Rated', and normal premium calculation is bypassed.

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=211620703"
]

**4. Multiple Revision Handling**
Given multiple policy transactions exist on effective date, When system selects in-force revision, Then revision with maximum revision number is chosen.

**5. Incomplete Data Handling**

#### Feature: Assign Producers and Compensation to Quotes and Policies
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: correct producer assignments and compensation arrangements retroactively on issued policies or new business quotes
- **Value**: the policy maintains accurate producer commission records from inception without maintaining disruptive change history for correction scenarios

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **correct producer assignments and compensation arrangements retroactively on issued policies or new business quotes**,
So that **the policy maintains accurate producer commission records from inception without maintaining disruptive change history for correction scenarios**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Correction Initiation and Eligibility Validation**
User initiates producer correction for individual policy or bulk population. System validates user privileges and policy state eligibility, rejecting requests on policies with pended quotes or cascading enrollment locks.

**2. Correction Method Determination**
User selects correction approach: merge manual producer assignments with existing master producer data, or substitute complete producer assignment structure. System validates only one method selected and source designations.

**3. Policy History Retroactive Update**
System retrieves all active policy revisions, archives original versions with incremented revision numbers, creates corrected premium split records from policy effective date, and propagates changes to pended transactions.

**4. Integration and Audit Trail**
System generates audit messages, transmits corrected producer data to downstream commission systems via transaction events, and updates compensation contract references without maintaining reversion capability.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Privilege and State Validation**
Given user lacks producer correction privileges or policy has pended quotes, When correction is requested, Then system denies action with appropriate authorization or business rule error.

**2. Correction Method Enforcement**
Given both merge and substitution parameters provided, When correction is submitted, Then system rejects request requiring single method selection.

**3. Policy History Overwrite**
Given issued policy with valid correction request, When correction executes successfully, Then system archives original policy revisions and creates corrected premium splits effective from policy inception date.

**4. Quote-Specific Handling**
Given correction requested on new business quote, When system processes correction, Then business-of-record transfer transaction is created instead of standard correction workflow.

**5. Downstream Propagation**
Given successful correction completion, When policy updates are finalized, Then corrected producer assignments are transmitted to commission systems via transaction issue events.

#### Feature: Apply Book of Business Filtering to Quotes Based on Organizational Structure

**Failed Validation Handling**
Given invalid agency data during save, When validation fails, Then system prevents premium split persistence, saves quote without agency changes, and maintains original producer access.

#### Feature: Initiate and enroll individual member quotes into policies
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: enroll individual member quotes into active policies or manage policy lifecycle transactions
- **Value**: members are efficiently transitioned from quoted to insured status with accurate policy records and automated lifecycle management

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **enroll individual member quotes into active policies or manage policy lifecycle transactions**,
So that **members are efficiently transitioned from quoted to insured status with accurate policy records and automated lifecycle management**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Request Authorization & Validation**
System validates user privileges, authentication credentials, and entity lock status to prevent concurrent modification conflicts.

**2. Transaction Type Determination**
System identifies the enrollment transaction type (NEW_BUSINESS, NEW_BUSINESS_QUOTE, AMENDMENT, CANCELLATION, REINSTATEMENT, TERMINATION) and routes to appropriate processing logic.

**3. New Business & Quote Processing**
Upon new business or quote transactions, system creates issued policies or saved quotes with calculated premiums and archives source quotes.

**4. Amendment & Reinstatement Execution**
When policy modifications are requested, system applies transaction-specific rules and issues updated policy versions.

**5. Cancellation & Termination Handling**
If cancellation is requested, system verifies policy version status, validates effective dates, and transitions policy to cancelled state.

**6. Response Generation**
System returns enrolled policy or quote image with appropriate status indicators and error details if processing fails.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Successful New Business Enrollment**
Given a valid individual quote with NEW_BUSINESS transaction type, when enrollment is processed without errors, then an issued policy is created and source quotes are deleted.

**2. Quote Preservation for Partial Failures**
Given an enrollment request with premium calculation failure, when processing encounters EM>iprm0001 error, then neither policy nor quote is created; for other errors, a quote is created for manual completion.

**3. Transaction Type Validation**
Given an enrollment request with unsupported transaction type, when validation executes, then system returns error EM>enr0007 and halts processing.

**4. Cancellation Effective Date Verification**
Given a CANCELLATION request for already-cancelled policy, when effective dates mismatch, then system rejects the transaction and exits.

**5. Amendment Authorization**
Given an AMENDMENT transaction request, when user lacks appropriate security privileges, then system denies access before processing logic.

**6. Concurrent Modification Prevention**
Given an entity lock exists on the policy version, when enrollment is attempted, then system returns EM>lck0003 error and prevents conflicting updates.

  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=502432715"
]

#### Feature: Validate census classes against master policy configuration

So that **the policy accurately reflects only authorized, active, and unique census classifications tied to the sponsoring organization**.


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Class Reference Aggregation**
System retrieves all census class references from master policy coverage configurations stored in policy repository.

**2. External Reference Integrity Verification**
System validates external references resolve correctly to customer entity management system; halts process if links are broken or system unavailable.

**3. Ownership & Authorization Validation**
System confirms all census classes belong exclusively to the policy's group sponsor organization.

**4. Active Status & Uniqueness Confirmation**
System verifies classes remain active and class identifiers are unique across the policy configuration.

**3. Ownership Violation**
Given census classes belong to different sponsors or non-policy owner, when validation runs, then system rejects configuration with ownership mismatch error.

**4. Inactive Class Detection**
Given at least one assigned class is no longer active, when validation occurs, then system prevents progression with inactive class error.

**5. Duplicate Identifier Detection**
Given multiple classes share identical class numbers, when validation processes, then system blocks configuration with uniqueness violation error.

#### Feature: Execute state machine transitions for disability master rewrite quotes
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: execute state machine transitions for disability master rewrite quotes throughout their lifecycle
- **Value**: the system maintains proper governance and progression from quote initiation through issuance and policy conversion

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **execute state machine transitions for disability master rewrite quotes throughout their lifecycle**,
So that **the system maintains proper governance and progression from quote initiation through issuance and policy conversion**


**Key Capabilities:**

**State Machine Selection**
Upon command execution, system determines appropriate state machine based on variation (quote/policy) and transaction type (REWRITE), defaulting to product specification if no match exists.

**Quote Data Gathering and Rating**
User is able to collect quote information in dataGather state, then execute rating to transition to rated state, with write commands conditionally preserving or reverting state based on premium impact detection.

**Decline Path Management**
When customer or company decline commands execute from dataGather or rated states, system transitions to terminal decline states while allowing recovery via write commands.

**Issuance and Policy Conversion**
User is able to issue quote from rated state, transitioning to issued state and converting to policy variation with sustained issued state for policy operations.

**Administrative Operations**
System preserves current state when executing copy, version, delete, or legacy synchronization commands from any valid state.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Correct State Machine Applied**
Given variation is 'quote' and transaction type is 'REWRITE', when command executes, then system applies Rewrite Quote State Machine per product specification.

**Premium Impact Drives Transitions**
Given quote in rated state, when write command executes with premium impact detected, then system transitions to dataGather; when no premium impact detected, then system remains in rated state.

**Decline States Are Terminal**
Given quote in dataGather or rated state, when customer or company decline command executes, then system transitions to respective decline state and prevents rating or issuance until recovery.

**Issuance Requires Rating**
Given quote in dataGather or decline state, when issue command attempts execution, then system prevents issuance; given quote in rated state, when issue command executes, then system transitions to issued state.

**Policy State Persists**
Given policy in issued state, when legacy or synchronization commands execute, then system maintains issued state throughout operations.

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=463481942"
]

#### Feature: Enroll individual new business quotes and generate issuance documents
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: enroll individual new business quotes and generate policy issuance documents
- **Value**: the system automatically transitions approved quotes to active policies with accurate premium calculations and synchronized master policy data

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **enroll individual new business quotes and generate policy issuance documents**,
So that **the system automatically transitions approved quotes to active policies with accurate premium calculations and synchronized master policy data**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Quote Persistence and Validation**
User is able to save individual new business quotes to the system with transaction type classification (NEW_BUSINESS or NEW_BUSINESS_QUOTE) for subsequent processing.

**2. Premium Calculation**
Upon successful quote persistence, system automatically computes premium amounts based on saved quote parameters.

**3. Conditional Policy Issuance**
When transaction type equals NEW_BUSINESS, system issues the quote to generate an active individual policy; quotes marked NEW_BUSINESS_QUOTE bypass issuance.

**4. Source Quote Cleanup**
If policy issuance succeeds and term numbers match between quote and policy, system deletes the originating quote to prevent duplication.

**5. Master Policy Synchronization**
Upon policy creation, system synchronizes with master policy to apply hierarchical changes and maintain data consistency across policy structures.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Successful Full Enrollment Path**
Given a NEW_BUSINESS quote exists, when user initiates enrollment, then system persists quote, calculates premiums, issues policy, deletes source quote (if term numbers match), and synchronizes with master policy.

**2. Quote-Only Preservation Path**
Given a NEW_BUSINESS_QUOTE exists, when user initiates enrollment, then system persists quote and calculates premiums but skips policy issuance, quote deletion, and master synchronization steps.

**3. Quote Persistence Failure Handling**
Given quote save operation fails, when system detects error, then process terminates immediately with error code and message without attempting premium calculation or subsequent steps.

**4. Premium Calculation Failure Handling**
Given premium calculation fails after successful quote save, when system detects error, then process terminates with error code and message without proceeding to issuance steps.

**5. Policy Issuance Failure Handling**
Given NEW_BUSINESS quote with successful premium calculation, when policy issuance fails, then system returns error code and message without deleting quote or synchronizing master policy.

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=511120976"
]

Given quote from any line of business, When archive is requested, Then system applies consistent preservation logic regardless of business line.

#### Feature: Save quote drafts with automatic state persistence
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: save quote drafts with automatic state validation and persistence
- **Value**: work can be preserved incrementally while maintaining data integrity and compliance with business rules throughout the quote lifecycle

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **save quote drafts with automatic state validation and persistence**,
So that **work can be preserved incrementally while maintaining data integrity and compliance with business rules throughout the quote lifecycle**


**Key Capabilities:**

**Request Validation & Security Enforcement**
System validates performer privileges, verifies quote lock status, and enforces business dimension security filtering against user profile before processing draft.

**Business Rule Validation**
Upon submission, system executes configured validation rules, decision tables, and package eligibility checks; prevents persistence if critical business constraints violated.

**Party & Form Management**
System synchronizes party information from policy data and automatically updates form versions when new instances added or date-driven dimensions change.

**Intelligent State Determination**
When rating-affecting attributes modified in Rated quotes (non-NPBE), system automatically reverts status to Data Gather; preserves Rated status if only non-rating changes made.

**Transaction Persistence**
System persists quote image using configured update strategy (partial/full), logs change history with performer attribution, and triggers monitoring events for audit trail.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Draft Saved Successfully**
Given performer has valid privileges and quote lock, When submitting compliant quote image without rating-affecting changes, Then system persists draft with current status and returns complete quote identification.

**Status Reverted on Rating Changes**
Given quote currently in Rated status (non-NPBE), When rating-affected attributes modified, Then system saves draft and automatically transitions status to Data Gather with audit trail.

**Validation Failures Prevent Persistence**
Given quote image violates business rules or security constraints, When attempting save operation, Then system rejects submission with specific error messages without persisting changes.

**Form Versions Auto-Updated**
Given product model includes form versioning, When date dimensions change or duplicate form instances detected, Then system automatically updates to current form version before persistence.

**NPBE Status Protected**
Given quote classified as NPBE or OOS_NPBE with Rated status, When attempting to save with rating changes, Then system blocks operation and returns restriction error.

**Party Data Synchronized**
Given product model includes party information, When saving quote draft, Then system invokes party service to synchronize policy-level party data before persistence.

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=196120900"

#### Feature: Cascade quote status changes to dependent member quotes and policies
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: propagate status changes from master policy to dependent member quotes through automated cascading logic
- **Value**: all dependent quotes maintain consistent state and processing visibility across the policy hierarchy

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **propagate status changes from master policy to dependent member quotes through automated cascading logic**,
So that **all dependent quotes maintain consistent state and processing visibility across the policy hierarchy**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Cascading Status Initiation**
System receives status change event from master policy and identifies all associated member quotes requiring synchronization.

**2. Member-Level Status Evaluation**
System processes individual member quote statuses and applies business rules to determine cascading flags (in-progress, completed, failed, manual, suspended).

**3. Master Policy Status Aggregation**
System evaluates all member statuses and determines master policy cascading state using priority logic: active processing overrides completion, completion overrides failure.
    3.1 When at least one member shows in-progress or manual processing, master status reflects active processing.
    3.2 When all members are completed or unaffected, master status reflects successful completion.

**4. Exception Handling**
System identifies failed member quotes and escalates master policy status when all processing completes with failures present.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Active Processing Priority**
Given multiple member quotes under master policy, When at least one member has active or manual processing status, Then master policy displays active processing state regardless of other member statuses.

**2. Successful Completion Aggregation**
Given all member quotes processed, When all members show completed or unaffected status, Then master policy reflects successful completion state.

**3. Failure State Escalation**
Given all member quotes processed, When at least one member failed and no active processing remains, Then master policy reflects failed state.

**4. Uninitialized Member Handling**
Given member quote without cascading flag, When status is requested, Then system displays indicator for no cascading process initiated.

**5. Status Synchronization Integrity**
Given cascading initiated, When backend status changes occur, Then UI reflects accurate mapped status within defined synchronization window.


**Reference URLs:**

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=471578261"
]

#### Feature: Execute individual quote direct application flow with data gathering

- **Value**: the quote progresses from initiation through premium calculation to application submission, ensuring all participant, coverage, and underwriting requirements are validated before policy issuance

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **execute a direct application workflow for individual insurance quotes with comprehensive data gathering and underwriting assessment**,
So that **the quote progresses from initiation through premium calculation to application submission, ensuring all participant, coverage, and underwriting requirements are validated before policy issuance**.


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Quote Initiation & Policy Foundation**
User is able to initiate quote from navigation menu or customer portfolio. System retrieves product configuration, applies entry point rules, and enables optional updates to effective date and jurisdiction.

**2. Participant Information Gathering**
User is able to specify participant details with system validation. Upon navigation, first participant card opens in edit mode for data entry.

**3. Coverage & Contract Specification**
User is able to define coverage selections aligned with product rules. System retrieves eligible plans and value lists based on entry point configuration.

**4. Underwriting Questionnaire Processing**
User is able to complete mandatory questionnaires. System synchronizes insureds, validates completeness, calculates underwriting decision and classification upon submission.

**5. Premium Calculation & Validation**
User is able to trigger premium calculation after questionnaire approval. System validates all data across tabs, computes premiums with underwriting classification, and displays summary.

**6. Application Submission**
When decision is not declined, user is able to submit application. System transitions quote status and redirects to opportunity dashboard.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

Given user has appropriate privileges, when initiating quote from menu or customer portfolio, then system displays application flow with product configuration applied and quote in initialized status.

**3. Underwriting Decision Calculation**
Given all mandatory questionnaire responses are complete, when user triggers decision calculation, then system displays decision for quote and each insured with applicable underwriting classification.

**4. Premium Calculation Readiness**
Given quote is in data gathering state without completed questionnaire decision, when user attempts premium calculation, then system prevents action and displays status error message.

**5. Application Submission Control**
Given questionnaire decision is declined, when user reaches premium summary, then system disables application submission capability.

**6. Successful Application Submission**
Given all validations pass and decision is approved, when user submits application, then system transitions quote status and redirects to opportunity case dashboard.

### Epic: Quote Comparison & Analysis

#### Feature: Compare multiple quote variations side-by-side with financial impact analysis
- **Role**: Policy Issuer
- **Action**: compare multiple quote variations side-by-side with automated financial impact analysis
- **Value**: I can identify coverage differences and premium impacts to recommend optimal policy options during the issuance process

**Description:**

As a **Policy Issuer**,
I want to **compare multiple quote variations side-by-side with automated financial impact analysis**,
So that **I can identify coverage differences and premium impacts to recommend optimal policy options during the issuance process**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Quote Selection for Comparison**
User is able to designate two policy offers from available variations for side-by-side analysis during premium and coverage evaluation stage.

**2. Automated Difference Identification**
System executes comparison logic to identify coverage, benefit, and structural differences between selected quotes.

**3. Financial Impact Calculation**
System computes premium differentials and cost implications resulting from coverage variations between compared options.

**4. Consolidated Comparison Presentation**
System displays side-by-side comparison view highlighting differences, premium data, and financial impacts to support decision-making.
    4.1 When financial impact data is unavailable, system displays coverage differences only without premium analysis.
    4.2 Upon comparison failure, system terminates process and surfaces diagnostic error information.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Successful Dual-Quote Comparison**
Given two policy offers are selected for analysis, When comparison process executes successfully, Then system presents side-by-side view with coverage differences and calculated financial impacts.

**2. Degraded Mode Operation**
Given financial impact calculation is unavailable, When comparison completes, Then system displays coverage differences without premium analysis data.

**3. Comparison Prerequisite Validation**
Given fewer than two offers are designated, When user attempts comparison, Then system prevents execution until selection criteria are satisfied.

**4. Comparison Failure Handling**
Given comparison logic encounters processing error, When failure occurs, Then system terminates workflow and communicates diagnostic information without displaying partial results.

#### Feature: Validate and persist quote changes with selective save operations (quote-level, offer-level, or full)
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: Selectively persist quote modifications at appropriate granularity levels
- **Value**: Changes are efficiently saved with optimal system performance and data integrity across all quote components

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **selectively persist quote modifications at appropriate granularity levels**,
So that **changes are efficiently saved with optimal system performance and data integrity across all quote components**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Save Operation Authorization**
System validates write permissions for current quote version; when permissions are absent, quote opens in inquiry-only mode preventing any persistence operations.

**2. Change Scope Detection**
Upon save initiation, system analyzes modified components distinguishing between single-offer changes, quote-level changes, and multi-component modifications to determine appropriate persistence strategy.

**3. Granular Persistence Execution**
When single offer modified, system executes offer-specific update operation; when only quote changed, system executes quote-level persistence; when multiple components changed, system executes comprehensive save operation.

**4. Session Continuation Management**
User is able to continue editing after standard save or exit to consolidated view after save-and-exit, with navigation varying by product line.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Authorization Enforcement**
Given quote lacks write permissions, when user accesses quote, then system presents inquiry mode only without any save capabilities.

**2. Single-Component Optimization**
Given only one offer modified with unchanged quote, when user initiates save, then system executes offer-specific persistence operation without updating entire quote structure.

**3. Multi-Component Handling**
Given quote and multiple offers modified, when user initiates save, then system executes comprehensive persistence operation updating all changed components with full validation rules.

**4. Null-Change Protection**
Given no actual modifications detected, when user initiates save, then system executes lightweight quote persistence without reference updates and displays success confirmation.

**5. Product-Specific Behavior**
Given Personal Home v2 product context, when any save operation initiates, then system always executes full write operation regardless of change scope.

#### Feature: Cascade Quote Modifications to Member Quotes
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: automatically propagate master policy changes to all associated member quote revisions
- **Value**: member quotes remain synchronized with master policy updates without manual intervention, reducing errors and processing time

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **automatically propagate master policy changes to all associated member quote revisions**,
So that **member quotes remain synchronized with master policy updates without manual intervention, reducing errors and processing time**.


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Eligibility Validation**
Upon master policy transaction initiation (excluding rewrite), system validates member quote revision eligibility by checking cascading process status, master link associations, and processing flags to prevent conflicts.

**2. Transaction-Based Flow Routing**
System identifies master policy transaction type and invokes corresponding cascading strategy (issue, amendment, cancellation, renewal, reinstate, rescind, or BOR transfer) to apply appropriate business logic.

**3. Revision Processing Orchestration**
System iteratively processes all member quote revisions, tracking completion status via processing flags, and loops until all eligible revisions receive cascaded changes.

**4. Exception Handling**
When uncompleted cascading processes are detected (IN_PROGRESS or FAILED states), system suspends flow for affected member quotes to preserve data consistency.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Eligible Revisions Processed**
Given a master policy transaction is initiated, when member quote revisions meet eligibility criteria (valid master link, no conflicting processes), then system successfully cascades changes to all qualifying revisions.

**2. Ineligible Revisions Excluded**
Given member quote revisions exist with uncompleted cascading processes (IN_PROGRESS/FAILED states), when eligibility validation executes, then system suspends cascading for those revisions and continues with eligible ones.

**3. Transaction-Specific Logic Applied**
Given different master policy transaction types (issue, amendment, cancellation, renewal), when cascading executes, then system applies corresponding business rules specific to each transaction category.

**4. Completion Tracking**
Given cascading completes for all member quote revisions, when final validation occurs, then system updates processing flags with appropriate state values (COMPLETED/NOT_AFFECTED) and terminates workflow.

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=570105395"
