#### Feature: Process out-of-sequence renewals on member records
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: cascade out-of-sequence renewals from master policies to member records while preserving business continuity
- **Value**: master policy changes automatically propagate to members, ensuring consistency across the policy hierarchy without manual intervention

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **cascade out-of-sequence renewals from master policies to member records while preserving business continuity**,
So that **master policy changes automatically propagate to members, ensuring consistency across the policy hierarchy without manual intervention**.


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Renewal Event Detection & Validation**
Upon master policy renewal issuance or roll-on completion, system identifies affected member records based on renewal effective date and validates in-force revisions for eligibility.

**2. Impact Assessment & Suspension Logic**
System evaluates member status (cancelled, ported, suspended) and applies do-not-cascade rules. When portability suspension is enabled or all changes fall under exclusion scenarios, cascading halts with appropriate status flags.

**3. Quote Preparation & Data Replication**
System removes pended quotes, generates renewal quotes with cascaded effective dates, and replicates master policy changes using defined strategies while preserving member-specific customizations.

**4. Premium Calculation & Issuance**
System calculates premiums for replicated data and issues renewal quotes. For out-of-sequence renewals, three-way comparison algorithm resolves conflicts, ignoring master link discrepancies.

**5. Failure Handling & Status Tracking**
When breaking changes, calculation failures, or issuance errors occur, system marks cascading as failed and preserves audit trail through policy flag storage states.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Successful Cascading Completion**
Given master policy renewal is issued, when member record is active and no suspension rules apply, then system creates new member renewal quote linked to master, replicates changes, calculates premium, and updates status to 'COMPLETED'.

**2. Portability Suspension Enforcement**
Given member record is ported and suspension configuration is enabled, when master renewal triggers cascading, then system sets status to 'SUSPENDED' without creating new member version or propagating changes.

**3. Effective Date Reconciliation**
Given cascaded renewal effective date precedes member effective date, when generating renewal, then system uses member effective date instead and continues cascading process with adjusted timeline.

**4. Breaking Change Failure Handling**
Given data replication encounters breaking changes, when system attempts to replicate from master, then cascading stops immediately, status updates to 'FAILED', and no premium calculation or issuance occurs.

**5. Pended Quote Cleanup**
Given member record contains pended quotes, when cascading initiates, then system deletes all pended quotes before generating new renewal quote to prevent version conflicts.

**6. Out-of-Sequence Conflict Resolution**
Given affecting revision is OOS renewal with conflicts, when three-way comparison detects only master link discrepancies, then system ignores conflict and completes auto roll-on successfully.

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=534807234"
]

#### Feature: Suspend cascading renewals and flag member records with suspension status
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: manage suspended cascading renewals and resume or maintain suspension status for member records during subsequent master policy renewals
- **Value**: member record integrity is preserved when master policy changes conflict with member-specific coverage, preventing automatic propagation of incompatible changes

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **manage suspended cascading renewals and resume or maintain suspension status for member records during subsequent master policy renewals**,
So that **member record integrity is preserved when master policy changes conflict with member-specific coverage, preventing automatic propagation of incompatible changes**.


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Subsequent Renewal Initiation**
User is able to initiate sequential renewals on master policy with suspended cascading flags on associated member records from prior renewal transactions.

**2. Change Compatibility Assessment**
Upon renewal submission, system evaluates whether first suspended renewal involved class/plan removal affecting member record coverage.
    2.1 If removal occurred, system maintains SUSPENDED status for subsequent renewals
    2.2 If no removal occurred, system proceeds to cascading eligibility determination

**3. Cascading Decision Execution**
When subsequent renewal has member impact and no prior class/plan removal, system resets flag to COMPLETED, creates new member record version, and links to cascaded renewal. When renewal has no member impact or prior removal exists, system maintains SUSPENDED status without version creation.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Suspension Maintained for Class/Plan Removal**
Given first renewal involved class/plan removal used by member record, when subsequent renewal is processed, then system maintains SUSPENDED flag status and prevents member record version creation.

**2. Cascading Resumed for Compatible Changes**
Given first suspended renewal did NOT involve class/plan removal, when subsequent renewal impacts member record, then system resets flag to COMPLETED, creates new member record version, and establishes linkage to cascaded renewal.

**3. No-Impact Renewal Handling**
Given subsequent renewal has no impact on member record, when renewal is issued, then system maintains SUSPENDED status without creating member record version regardless of first renewal change type.

User creates master policy with current effective date, then initiates amendment with future effective date extending beyond original term.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

**2. Amendment-Triggered Renewal Recognition**
Given master policy exists with amendment effective date one year forward, When rewrite transaction occurs three months offset from original term, Then system generates OOS rate guarantee renewal quote automatically.

**3. Quote Lifecycle Completion**
Given OOS renewal quote exists in contractAccepted state, When roll-on and issuance commands execute without data gathering requirements, Then system transitions quote to issued state creating renewal policy.

**4. Business Rule Parity**
Given OOS renewal transaction processes, When system evaluates mandatory installations and field validations, Then identical rules apply as standard rate guarantee renewals.

**5. Conditional State Transition Handling**
Given roll-on operation requires data gathering, When isDataGatherForRolledOnQuote returns true, Then system transitions to dataGatherAfterContractAccepted state instead of remaining in contractAccepted.

#### Feature: Process no-change rate guarantee renewals on master policies
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: process no-change rate guarantee renewals on master policies with intelligent cascading to member records
- **Value**: operational efficiency is maximized by preventing unnecessary member policy renewals when master policy changes do not impact premiums or member-level coverage

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **process no-change rate guarantee renewals on master policies with intelligent cascading to member records**,
So that **operational efficiency is maximized by preventing unnecessary member policy renewals when master policy changes do not impact premiums or member-level coverage**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Master Policy Renewal Evaluation**
System evaluates master policy renewal attributes and identifies changes between previous and new revision versions for cascading eligibility determination.

**2. Version Comparison and Change Detection**
System performs JSON equality checks comparing plans, class groups, and coverage modification filters to detect premium-impacting changes (plan additions/removals, class updates, coverage modifications, tier changes, reset-strategy attributes).

**3. Cascading Strategy Decision**
Upon detecting premium-impacting changes, system applies 'rateGuaranteeRenewPolicy' strategy creating V2 renewals on both master and member policies; when no material changes exist, system applies 'markAsSuspended' strategy preventing member record renewal creation.

**4. Exception Handling for No-Change Scenarios**
When master policy updates include only non-premium-impacting attributes or attributes using default/ignore replication strategies, system suspends cascading and sets suspended flags without creating member renewal versions.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Cascading Proceeds for Material Changes**
Given master policy renewal contains plan additions/removals, coverage modifications, class updates, tier changes, or reset-strategy attribute updates, When cascading strategy is evaluated, Then system selects 'rateGuaranteeRenewPolicy' and creates V2 renewals on both master and member policies.

**2. Cascading Suspended for Non-Material Changes**
Given master policy renewal contains only master-specific non-premium-impacting attributes or attributes using default/ignore strategies, When cascading strategy is evaluated, Then system selects 'markAsSuspended' and prevents member record renewal creation.

**3. Accurate Version Comparison**
Given system compares masterPrevious with masterNewRevision, When JSON equality checks execute on plans, classGroups (excluding _key), and coverage filters, Then system accurately detects all material differences triggering cascading decisions.

**4. Exception Handling for Attribute Strategy Conflicts**
Given master policy renewal includes attribute updates where attribute lacks reset strategy, When cascading is evaluated, Then system creates V2 master renewal but suspends member cascading and logs exception.

### Epic: Renewal Quote Creation & Management

#### Feature: Initiate renewal quote creation from existing policy
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: initiate renewal quote creation from an active or expired policy to prepare for the next policy term
- **Value**: the organization can proactively engage customers for coverage adjustments and ensure continuity of coverage before term expiration

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **initiate renewal quote creation from an active or expired policy to prepare for the next policy term**,
So that **the organization can proactively engage customers for coverage adjustments and ensure continuity of coverage before term expiration**


**Key Capabilities:**

**Policy Eligibility Validation**
Upon renewal request, system verifies policy holder has renewal privileges, policy is in active or expired state, and no blocking flags (Cancel Notice, Do Not Renew) are set. System prevents renewal if conflicting quote or policy versions exist for next term.

**Renewal Quote Generation**
System creates new quote version from latest active policy in Data Gather status, automatically determining next term dates and inheriting policy data. System applies product-specific configuration rules and invokes renewal entry point logic.

**Business Rule Application**
System removes expired premium overrides, resets offer selections to recalculation state, and applies any pending broker-of-record transfers. System executes configured decision tables and validation rules per product requirements.

**Legacy Policy Support**
When initiating from legacy policy variation, system validates data completeness and creates renewal quote variation, ensuring migration continuity from legacy systems.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Valid Renewal Initiation**
Given an active policy with no blocking flags, when administrator initiates renewal, then system creates new quote version in Data Gather status for next term with inherited policy data and reset premium calculations.

**Blocking Flag Prevention**
Given a policy with Cancel Notice or Do Not Renew flag set to true, when renewal is requested, then system rejects request and returns appropriate error without creating quote.

**Duplicate Prevention**
Given an active renewal quote or policy already exists for next term, when administrator attempts renewal initiation, then system prevents creation and notifies of existing renewal version.

**Legacy Policy Renewal**
Given a legacy policy variation with complete data, when renewal is initiated, then system creates renewal quote variation inheriting legacy data structure and applies current product rules.

**Broker Transfer Application**
Given an active broker-of-record transfer request exists, when renewal quote is created, then system automatically applies agency/agent changes to the new renewal quote version.

#### Feature: Execute quote state machine transitions for renewal lifecycle
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: execute state transitions throughout the renewal quote lifecycle to progress quotes from creation through policy issuance
- **Value**: I can ensure quotes follow controlled business rules and maintain data integrity across renewal, endorsement, and purchase operations

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **execute state transitions throughout the renewal quote lifecycle to progress quotes from creation through policy issuance**,
So that **I can ensure quotes follow controlled business rules and maintain data integrity across renewal, endorsement, and purchase operations**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Quote Initiation and Rating Workflow**
User is able to progress quotes from data collection phase through rating operations to calculate premiums, then advance to purchase-ready status following the primary path: dataGather  rate  rated  initiatePurchase  purchasePending.

**2. Premium-Impacted Modification Handling**
When data changes impact premium calculations during rated state, system transitions quote back to dataGather requiring re-rating. Upon non-premium-impacting changes, quote maintains rated state allowing minor updates without recalculation.

**3. Quote Suspension and Restoration**
User is able to temporarily suspend quotes during data gathering, transition to suspended state, then restore via removeSuspense operation returning to dataGather. If quotes expire, system enables restoration from expired state back to active data collection.

**4. Purchase Completion and Issue Management**
Upon successful purchase validation, system progresses through renewalIssue/rollOnIssue operations to issued state. When purchase or issue failures occur, system maintains purchasePending or transitions to issueFailed enabling retry or corrective action.

**5. Version Control and Rollback Operations**
User is able to create new quote versions from expired, rated, suspended, or dataGather states transitioning to fresh dataGather state. System supports rollBackTerm and rollBackIssue operations with conditional routing based on cancellation status or business rules.

**6. Terminal State and Archival Processing**
When quotes require permanent removal, system transitions to archived terminal state. Upon cancellation requirements during issue process, conditional logic routes to cancelled terminal state maintaining complete audit trail.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Successful Primary Lifecycle Progression**
Given a new renewal quote in dataGather state, When user completes data collection and executes rating operation, Then system transitions through rated  purchasePending  issued states upon successful validation at each stage.

**2. Premium-Impact Detection and Re-Rating**
Given a quote in rated state with calculated premium, When user modifies data triggering premium impact detection (isPremiumImpactDetected=true), Then system transitions back to dataGather state requiring re-rating before proceeding to purchase.

**3. Suspension and Expiration Recovery**
Given a suspended or expired quote, When user executes removeSuspense or quoteRestoration operation, Then system transitions to dataGather state enabling quote resumption without data loss and maintains operation history.

**4. Purchase Failure Handling**
Given a quote in purchasePending state, When purchase validation fails and purchaseFail operation executes, Then system maintains purchasePending state allowing retry attempts while preserving quote integrity.

**5. Conditional Issue Rollback Routing**
Given a quote undergoing issue rollback, When rollBackIssue operation executes with rollBackIssueState() evaluation, Then system conditionally routes to issued, cancelled, or termBackedOff states based on business context and cancellation flags.

**6. Terminal State Enforcement**
Given any active quote state, When archiveQuote operation executes, Then system transitions to archived terminal state preventing further modifications and ensuring immutable audit trail preservation.

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=588161693"
]

#### Feature: Execute renewal quote state transitions for personal home products
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: orchestrate renewal quote lifecycle state transitions from initial data gathering through policy issuance
- **Value**: renewal quotes progress systematically through validation, rating, offering, and issuance stages with proper controls for corrections, failures, and exception handling

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **orchestrate renewal quote lifecycle state transitions from initial data gathering through policy issuance**,
So that **renewal quotes progress systematically through validation, rating, offering, and issuance stages with proper controls for corrections, failures, and exception handling**.


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Initial Data Collection & Rating**
User is able to progress quote from data gathering through premium calculation (dataGatherraterated) and prepare for customer presentation (readyForOffer state)

**2. Offer Finalization & Purchase Initiation**
User is able to complete offer presentation (completeOfferofferCompleted) and initiate purchase workflow (initiatePurchasepurchasePending)

**3. Policy Issuance & Completion**
User is able to execute renewal or roll-on issuance (renewalIssue/rollOnIssueissued state) completing quote-to-policy conversion

**4. Data Correction & Re-Rating**
When modifications are needed, user is able to revert quote to dataGather state via write commands unless premium remains unchanged, then quote stays rated

**5. Purchase Failure Recovery**
Upon purchase failures, user is able to retry from purchasePending (purchaseFail), cancel to rated state (purchaseCancelling), or handle issuance failures (issueFailissueFailed)

**6. Quote Suspension & Expiration Management**
User is able to temporarily suspend quotes (suspensesuspendedremoveSuspense) or expire validity (expireexpired), with archival as terminal state


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Happy Path Progression**
Given quote in dataGather state, when rate and completeOffer commands execute successfully, then quote progresses dataGatherratedreadyForOfferofferCompletedpurchasePendingissued without data loss

**2. Premium-Impact Data Modification**
Given quote in rated state, when write command executes with isPremiumImpactDetected(true), then system transitions quote to dataGather requiring re-rating; when isPremiumImpactDetected(false), then quote remains rated

**3. Purchase Failure Handling**
Given quote in purchasePending state, when purchaseFail command executes, then quote remains purchasePending allowing retry; when issueFail executes, then quote transitions to issueFailed state blocking further copy operations

**4. Conditional Issuance Outcomes**
Given quote in purchasePending state, when rollOnIssue executes with isCancellation(true), then system transitions to cancelled state instead of issued state

**5. Suspension & Reactivation**
Given quote in dataGather/offerCompleted/readyForOffer states, when suspense command executes, then quote transitions to suspended; when removeSuspense executes, then quote returns to dataGather for workflow resumption

**6. Terminal State Enforcement**
Given quote in any active state, when archiveQuote command executes, then system transitions to archived state preventing all further state transitions or modifications

User advances quote through ready-for-proposal status; optionally marks as sold to reflect customer commitment; system manages status transitions and enables downstream issuance actions

**5. Renewal Issuance & Policy Version Creation**
User initiates issuance process; system navigates through installation screens, validates completeness, issues renewal transaction, creates new policy version, and redirects to customer portfolio with completion notification

**6. Exception Handling & Transaction Conflicts**
When conflicts detected (pending transactions, out-of-sequence dates), system prompts for confirmation; upon approval, system deletes conflicting transactions or processes out-of-sequence changes with roll-on requirements


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Renewal Initiation Validation**
Given a master policy with next renewal effective date defined, when user initiates renewal action, then system displays configuration interface with date defaulted to next renewal effective date and allows selection of additional eligible policies

**2. Effective Date Constraint Enforcement**
Given user selects renewal effective date earlier than master policy effective date, when validation executes, then system prevents continuation and displays date constraint violation message

**3. Opportunity Case Creation & Quote Linkage**
Given valid renewal configuration without existing opportunity case selection, when user confirms continuation, then system creates new renewal opportunity case, generates renewal quotes for selected policies, and establishes linkage relationships

**4. Rate Calculation & Premium Determination**
Given renewal quote in data gathering stage with updated policy attributes, when user triggers rate calculation, then system invokes rating engine, populates premium summary, and enables proposal progression actions

**5. Issuance Completion & Policy Versioning**
Given renewal quote in sold or ready-for-proposal status with calculated rates, when user completes issuance workflow, then system creates new policy version, displays transaction in completed history, and generates business activity notification

**6. Conflict Resolution for Pending Transactions**
Given master policy with pending amendment transactions, when user confirms renewal initiation, then system deletes conflicting pending transactions and proceeds with renewal quote creation workflow

#### Feature: Generate rate aggregates for rate guarantee renewal quotes

**3. Lifecycle-Based Rate Adjustment**
User adjusts rates at different stages (Data Gather, Proposal, Sold). System creates stage-specific rate aggregate types (Quoted, Proposed, Sold, Final) as copies with user modifications while clearing unadjusted values.

**3. Stage-Specific Adjustments**

**4. State Transition Propagation**
Given quote transitions to new stage, When proposal or contract acceptance occurs, Then system automatically creates corresponding rate aggregate copying most recent calculation data.

**5. Single Aggregate Constraint**
Given rate aggregate exists for specific type, When new aggregate of same type created, Then system overrides existing aggregate maintaining single version per rate type.

#### Feature: Execute renewal policy issuance from renewal quote
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: issue a validated renewal quote into an active policy term
- **Value**: the renewal policy becomes effective with accurate premiums, commissions, and billing integration while maintaining compliance with lifecycle rules and agency relationships

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **issue a validated renewal quote into an active policy term**,
So that **the renewal policy becomes effective with accurate premiums, commissions, and billing integration while maintaining compliance with lifecycle rules and agency relationships**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Authorization and Lifecycle Validation**
Upon request initiation, system verifies performer privileges, authenticates credentials, confirms quote currency, and validates that issuance action complies with product lifecycle configuration for the quote's current status.

**2. Concurrency Control and Relationship Validation**
System applies pessimistic policy lock, validates premium holders are not excluded, verifies agency validity for the term period, and confirms user access rights to associated organizations.

**3. Policy Version Creation and Data Propagation**
System creates new issued policy version, propagates flags from original quote, executes invocation point logic, recalculates premiums and commissions, and logs transaction details.

**4. Quote Archiving and Billing Integration**
System archives or deletes issued renewal quote and pending endorsement quotes per configuration, validates billing and customer requirements, notifies billing system, and triggers product-specific premium issuing.

**5. Status Finalization and Cleanup**
System updates policy status to Issued, removes active BOR transfer requests, triggers BAM events, and releases policy lock regardless of outcome.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Successful Issuance with Valid Prerequisites**
Given performer has issuance privileges and current renewal quote exists in valid status, When issuance is requested, Then system creates issued policy version, archives quotes per configuration, calculates premiums accurately, and returns active policy image.

**2. Authorization and Currency Rejection**
Given performer lacks issuance privileges or quote version is not current, When issuance is attempted, Then system returns authorization or currency error without creating policy version or modifying data.

**3. Agency Relationship Validation Failure**
Given quote lacks associated agency or agency validity period excludes term effective date, When issuance is requested, Then system prevents issuance and returns agency validation error.

**4. Concurrent Modification Prevention**
Given policy entity is locked by another performer, When issuance is attempted, Then system returns lock error and prevents duplicate processing.

**5. Billing Validation Failure Handling**
Given billing validation activities fail during issuance, When validation error occurs, Then system returns policy image with IssueFailed status without updating to Issued.

**6. Audit Trail Completeness**
Given issuance completes successfully or fails, When process concludes, Then system logs transaction history, triggers BAM event with appropriate status, and releases policy lock.

So that **I can systematically manage renewal contracts through standardized workflows with proper governance controls**

**1. Quote Initiation & Data Collection**
User is able to create renewal quotes and gather required information, transitioning from Create to Data Gathering state.

**2. Premium Calculation & Underwriting Evaluation**
Upon completion of data gathering, system routes to Premium Calculated state for direct pricing or In Underwriting Review state when evaluation is required.

**3. Proposal Preparation & Customer Presentation**

Given a quote in Proposed state, When customer accepts contract, Then system transitions to Sold state enabling issuance operations.

**4. Post-Acceptance Modification Control**
Given a quote in Sold state, When modifications are required before issuance, Then system enables data gathering while maintaining contract acceptance status.

**5. Decline State Management**
Given a quote in any active state, When company or customer decline occurs, Then system transitions to respective terminal decline state with option to resume processing.

User is able to collect renewal data in dataGather state, execute rating to transition to rated state, and optionally refer to underwriting review when risk assessment is required.

**2. Proposal Preparation & Customer Acceptance**
Upon rating completion, user is able to prepare proposal transitioning to readyForProposal, propose contract to customer moving to proposed state, and capture contract acceptance.

When data modifications detect premium impact after rating or acceptance, system automatically reverts quote to dataGather or dataGatherAfterContractAccepted state requiring re-rating.

User is able to record customer or company declines transitioning to respective declined states, then restart process via write or createVersion commands returning to dataGather.

Given quote in rated state requiring risk assessment, when user executes referToUnderwriting command, then system transitions to inUnderwritingReview blocking proposal until prepareForProposal is executed.

**4. Decline Recovery Mechanism**
Given quote in customerDeclined or companyDeclined state, when user executes write or createVersion command, then system returns to dataGather state enabling process restart.

**5. Roll-On State Determination**
Given policy in issued state, when user executes rollOn command with isDataGatherForRolledOnQuote flag false, then new quote transitions directly to rated state bypassing data collection.

Given quote in contractAccepted state, when user executes issue command, then system transitions to issued terminal state preventing further modifications except via roll-on.

### Epic: Policy Cancellation & Reinstatement

#### Feature: Initiate Policy Cancellation with Effective Date and Reason Capture
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: initiate and process policy cancellation requests with specified effective dates and documented reasons
- **Value**: I can terminate policy coverage in a controlled manner while ensuring accurate premium adjustments, proper handling of dependent transactions, and compliant billing integration

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **initiate and process policy cancellation requests with specified effective dates and documented reasons**,
So that **I can terminate policy coverage in a controlled manner while ensuring accurate premium adjustments, proper handling of dependent transactions, and compliant billing integration**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Cancellation Request Validation**
System validates performer privileges, policy identification, effective date boundaries within policy term, and ensures no conflicting future cancellations exist

**2. Policy State and Version Assessment**
System evaluates current policy state against permitted transitions and identifies future policy versions to determine standard, out-of-sequence, or renewal-impacted processing paths

**3. Premium Calculation and Proration**
System creates cancellation quote, copies existing rate data, calculates prorated premiums, and prepares billing impact information for integration

**4. Dependent Transaction Resolution**
System automatically handles pending endorsements and renewals through archival or deletion, and flat-cancels issued renewals in subsequent terms when prior term cancellation occurs

**5. Cancellation Issuance and Integration**
System issues cancellation quote, updates policy status to cancelled, transmits billing data, generates audit messages, and releases policy lock


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Authorization and Eligibility Verification**
Given performer submits cancellation request, When system validates security privileges and policy state, Then cancellation proceeds only if performer has cancellation privilege and policy state permits cancellation action

**2. Effective Date Boundary Enforcement**
Given cancellation effective date is specified, When system validates temporal boundaries, Then transaction is rejected if date falls outside policy term or future cancellation exists after requested date

**3. Premium Impact Accuracy**
Given cancellation is authorized, When system calculates premium adjustments, Then prorated premiums reflect accurate earned/unearned values and billing receives complete impact data

**4. Out-of-Sequence Processing**
Given future policy versions exist in same term, When cancellation is processed, Then system rolls back subsequent versions and creates OOS cancellation quote

**5. Renewal Chain Handling**
Given active renewals exist, When prior term cancellation is issued, Then system flat-cancels renewal versions and archives or deletes pending transactions per configuration

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=197100664"
]

#### Feature: Validate Out-of-Sequence Cancellations Against Endorsements and Renewals
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: process policy cancellation transactions that affect subsequent endorsements and renewals
- **Value**: I can maintain policy data integrity and accurately calculate financial impacts when cancellations occur retroactively or mid-term

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **process policy cancellation transactions that affect subsequent endorsements and renewals**,
So that **I can maintain policy data integrity and accurately calculate financial impacts when cancellations occur retroactively or mid-term**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Policy Eligibility Validation**
System validates cancellation request against policy term boundaries, existing future cancellations, and state machine permissions. Upon validation failure, process exits with specific error condition.

**2. Transaction Sequence Analysis**
System identifies future policy versions, endorsements, and renewals affected by cancellation effective date. Determines standard versus out-of-sequence processing path.

**3. Dependent Transaction Resolution**
When future versions exist, system rolls back affected endorsements within term and flat-cancels downstream renewals. Creates compensating transactions with backed-off status.

**4. Financial Impact Calculation**
System recalculates premiums using existing rate storage, prorates amounts, and validates against billing constraints before finalizing cancellation.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Effective Date Boundary Enforcement**
Given cancellation request, When effective date falls outside policy term boundaries, Then system rejects transaction with date range error.

**2. Future Cancellation Conflict Prevention**
Given existing future-dated cancellation, When new cancellation requested with earlier date, Then system blocks transaction to prevent conflicts.

**3. Out-of-Sequence Impact Resolution**
Given cancellation with future endorsements, When cancellation is processed, Then system automatically rolls back all subsequent versions and marks as backed-off.

**4. Renewal Cascade Cancellation**
Given cancellation affecting renewal terms, When processing completes, Then system flat-cancels all renewals after cancellation date with audit reason.

**5. Pending Quote Management**
Given active endorsement quotes, When cancellation finalizes, Then system archives or deletes pending quotes per configuration without manual intervention.

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=197100664"
]

#### Feature: Execute Policy Cancellation Transaction with State Transition
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: execute policy cancellation with state transition and premium adjustment
- **Value**: ensure accurate policy termination, financial reconciliation, and downstream system synchronization while handling complex scenarios like out-of-sequence changes and renewal impacts

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **execute policy cancellation with state transition and premium adjustment**,
So that **I can ensure accurate policy termination, financial reconciliation, and downstream system synchronization while handling complex scenarios like out-of-sequence changes and renewal impacts**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Cancellation Request Validation & Policy Identification**
Upon receiving cancellation request, system validates authorization privileges, identifies target policy, and verifies no conflicting future-dated cancellations exist. System confirms transaction effective date falls within policy term boundaries and state machine permits cancellation from current policy status.

**2. Policy Locking & Quote Preparation**
System locks policy for transaction isolation, creates cancellation quote by copying premium rates from existing policy version, and handles out-of-sequence scenarios by rolling back future policy versions when necessary.

**3. Premium Proration & Financial Calculation**
System calculates prorated premium adjustments for cancellation period, removes cancel notice flags if present, and prepares billing information package with calculated premium impacts.

**4. Pending Transaction Cleanup**
When pending endorsements or renewals exist, system archives or deletes them per configuration. For issued renewals after cancellation date, system automatically creates flat cancellations and rescinds previously cancelled renewal versions.

**5. Billing Integration & Validation**
System transmits cancellation details and premium adjustments to billing system for validation before finalizing transaction.
    5.1 If billing validation fails, system unlocks policy and returns purchase-pending status without committing cancellation.

**6. Transaction Finalization & Event Notification**
Upon successful billing validation, system issues cancellation quote, transitions policy status to 'Cancelled' per state machine, generates business activity monitoring message, and unlocks policy for future transactions.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Successful Standard Cancellation**
Given an active policy with no future versions, when administrator submits valid cancellation request with effective date within policy term, then system creates cancellation quote, calculates prorated premiums, updates billing, transitions policy to 'Cancelled' status, and generates audit message.

**2. Out-of-Sequence Cancellation Handling**
Given policy versions exist after requested cancellation date in same term, when cancellation is submitted, then system rolls back all future versions with backed-off status, creates OOS cancellation quote, and processes premium adjustments accordingly.

**3. Renewal Impact Processing**
Given issued renewal policies exist for terms after cancellation date, when cancellation is executed, then system automatically creates flat cancellation quotes for all affected renewals and rescinds any previously cancelled renewal versions.

**4. Billing Validation Failure Recovery**
Given cancellation quote prepared for issuance, when billing system validation fails, then system unlocks policy without status change, returns purchase-pending state, and preserves original policy data.

**5. Business Rule Violation Prevention**
Given cancellation request with effective date outside policy term or future-dated cancellation already exists, when validation occurs, then system rejects transaction with specific error message and prevents any policy modifications.

**6. Pending Transaction Cleanup**

**2. State Transition & Concurrency Control**
System verifies no active policy versions exist post-cancellation, validates reinstatement action against product state machine rules, and acquires an exclusive lock on the policy record.

System creates a new quote version from the cancelled policy, copies original premium and rate structures to maintain pricing continuity, and issues the quote following standard underwriting rules.

**2. Rejection for Invalid Effective Date**
Given a reinstatement request with an effective date, When the date falls outside the cancelled policy term or lapse period, Then the system prevents reinstatement and returns an appropriate error without modifying policy state.

**3. Concurrency Conflict Prevention**
Given multiple simultaneous reinstatement attempts on the same policy, When the first request acquires the policy lock, Then subsequent requests are blocked until lock release or timeout occurs.

**4. Master Policy Synchronization Integrity**
Given an individual policy linked to a master policy, When reinstatement completes successfully via the dedicated endpoint, Then the system applies all affected master policy revision changes to the reinstated individual policy automatically.

#### Feature: Prevent Cascading Cancellation to Ported Members
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: isolate ported member records from master policy lifecycle transactions
- **Value**: ported members maintain policy independence and avoid unintended coverage disruptions when the master policy undergoes changes

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **isolate ported member records from master policy lifecycle transactions**,
So that **ported members maintain policy independence and avoid unintended coverage disruptions when the master policy undergoes changes**.


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Master Policy Transaction Initiation**
When administrator executes renewal, reinstatement, rescission, rewrite, or BOR transfer on master policy, system evaluates all associated member records for cascading eligibility.

**2. Ported Member Identification**
System identifies members with issued port policies or active port quotes and compares member port effective date against master transaction effective date.

**3. Cascading Suspension Logic**
If member holds issued port policy AND port effective date precedes or equals master transaction date, system suspends cascading and marks status as SUSPENDED.
    3.1 For port quotes (non-issued), cascading proceeds normally for most transactions except rewrites

**4. Transaction Isolation Confirmation**
System records cascading status and prevents master policy changes from propagating to isolated member records, preserving individual policy independence.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Issued Port Policy Isolation**
Given member has issued port policy with effective date on/before master transaction date, When master policy undergoes renewal/reinstate/rescind/rewrite/BOR transfer, Then system sets cascading status to SUSPENDED and prevents transaction propagation to member record.

**2. Port Quote Handling**
Given member has port quote (not issued) with effective date on/before master transaction date, When master policy executes renewal/reinstate/rescind/BOR transfer, Then system allows normal cascading and marks status as NOT_AFFECTED.

**3. Effective Date Validation**
Given member port effective date is after master transaction effective date, When cascading evaluation occurs, Then system proceeds with standard cascading regardless of port status.

**4. Status Transparency**
Given cascading evaluation completes, When administrator views cascading results, Then system displays accurate SUSPENDED or NOT_AFFECTED status for ported members.

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **execute master policy cancellation with automated cascading business logic**,
So that **the organization can systematically terminate group coverage while ensuring regulatory compliance, financial accuracy, and stakeholder notification**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Cancellation Initiation**
User initiates master policy cancellation manually or system automatically triggers based on delinquency conditions. System retrieves policy data for processing.

**2. Eligibility Validation**
System validates policy positions and applies product-configured business rules. Upon validation failure, system reports errors and exits without proceeding.

**3. Financial Settlement Processing**
System locks policy, generates cancellation transaction quote, executes accounting entries, updates premium values, and performs policy tracking enrollment.

**4. Stakeholder Notification**
System dispatches email notifications to insured parties. If notification fails, system continues finalization without blocking completion.

**5. Transaction Finalization**
System updates transaction history, unlocks policy, reindexes records, and presents confirmation to user.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Successful Manual Cancellation**
Given valid cancellation request with compliant policy status, When administrator submits required data, Then system completes financial settlement and notifies stakeholders.

**2. Automatic Delinquency-Triggered Cancellation**
Given policy reaches delinquency threshold, When system automatically initiates cancellation, Then process executes without manual intervention using system-provided parameters.

**3. Validation Failure Handling**
Given policy positions fail validation rules, When system evaluates eligibility, Then cancellation is blocked and error details are reported without financial transactions.

**4. Financial Reconciliation Accuracy**
Given cancellation proceeds to settlement, When system generates transactions, Then accounting entries, premium updates, and transaction history reflect accurate financial state.

**5. Notification Resilience**
Given notification service unavailable, When system attempts stakeholder communication, Then cancellation completes successfully with notification failure logged separately.

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=743450800"
]

#### Feature: Execute policy revision selection to display effective or pending member record versions
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: retrieve the appropriate policy revision based on effective dates
- **Value**: accurate member record versions are displayed reflecting current, pending, or historical policy states

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **retrieve the appropriate policy revision based on effective dates**,
So that **accurate member record versions are displayed reflecting current, pending, or historical policy states**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. In-Force Revision Retrieval**
System retrieves the policy version in force for the requested date when an active revision exists.

**2. Future-Dated Pending Revision Selection**
When no in-force version exists for the requested date, system identifies active revisions, selects the minimal revision number, and retrieves the pending policy version if its effective date is future-dated.

**3. Historical Back-Dated Revision Selection**
If no future-dated revisions exist, system selects the active policy version with the maximum revision number representing the last active state of expired or cancelled policies.

**4. Contextual Version Determination**
System evaluates term effective dates against the requested date to automatically classify and retrieve current, pending, or historical policy states.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Current Policy Retrieval**
Given a policy with an in-force revision on the requested date, When the system executes version selection, Then the currently active policy version is returned.

**2. Pending Policy Retrieval**
Given no in-force revision exists and active revisions with future effective dates are present, When the system searches for the minimal revision number, Then the first pending policy version is returned.

**3. Historical Policy Retrieval**
Given no in-force or future-dated revisions exist, When the system identifies the maximum revision number, Then the last active version of the expired or cancelled policy is returned.

**4. Date-Based Version Classification**
Given a requested date, When the system compares term effective dates, Then the appropriate revision category (current, pending, or historical) is determined and the correct version is retrieved.

**1. Multi-Channel Navigation Support**

**3. Transaction History Availability**
Given user selects policy history view, When history tab activates, Then system retrieves and displays transaction records with effective dates and current status for each event.

**4. Pending Transaction Notification**
Given uncompleted transactions exist for the member record, When consolidated view renders, Then system displays alert banners indicating pending actions per notification specifications.

**5. Data Integrity Validation**
Given system retrieves policy transaction history, When data loads, Then all displayed transactions reflect accurate effective dates and status values from policy domain.

System loads additional product-specific attributes through transformation mappings between portfolio and policy models.

**3. Current Version Accuracy**
Given multiple quote versions exist for one root, When filtering applies, Then only versions marked as current are included in results.

**4. Product-Specific Data Completeness**
Given quotes from different product lines, When enrichment occurs, Then product-specific attributes are loaded per transformation mappings.

**5. Chronological Result Ordering**
Given multiple quotes retrieved, When sorting applies, Then results appear in descending term effective date order with root ID tiebreaker.

**6. Missing Parameter Protection**
Given no opportunity links provided, When retrieval attempts, Then system prevents execution and indicates missing required parameter.

#### Feature: Enable individual policy consolidated view component registration and UI builder configuration

- **Action**: configure and enable the individual policy consolidated view component for integrated member record access
- **Value**: stakeholders can access unified policy information and member data through a single consolidated interface, improving operational efficiency and decision-making

So that **stakeholders can access unified policy information and member data through a single consolidated interface, improving operational efficiency and decision-making**

**Dependency Registry Configuration**
System establishes service registry with bound policy stores, customer data repositories, and transaction services to support consolidated data retrieval.

System configures workbench selectors to extract policy identifiers and product attributes, enabling navigation and contextual data display across member records.

**Premium and Coverage Component Registration**
System registers premium summary tables, insured card views, and policy history components into UI builder schema for consolidated presentation.

**Consolidated View Assembly**

Given user navigates to consolidated view URL, When route parameters contain customer number and member record identifiers, Then system extracts parameters and loads corresponding policy data.

**Incomplete Data Handling**
Given required policy identifiers are missing from data selectors, When workbench attempts configuration, Then system prevents view rendering and returns null state.

**Successful Component Registration**
Given all UI builder definitions are added to schema, When system validates component registry, Then premium tables, coverage cards, and history components are accessible for rendering.

**Consolidated View Accessibility**
Given component is bound to product-specific URL, When authorized user accesses URL with valid parameters, Then system displays unified policy view with all registered sub-components.

#### Feature: Capture and validate customer demographic information during participant setup
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: capture and validate core demographic information for insurance participants across product lines
- **Value**: I ensure accurate participant records are established during policy setup to support underwriting, compliance, and policy servicing requirements

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **capture and validate core demographic information for insurance participants across product lines**,
So that **I ensure accurate participant records are established during policy setup to support underwriting, compliance, and policy servicing requirements**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Participant Identity Capture**
System collects essential personal identifiers including name components, birth date, gender, marital status, and tax identification based on participant role and product type.

**2. Product-Specific Data Collection**
System adapts data requirements dynamically: physical characteristics for underwriting (life products), driver classifications (motor), ownership structures (annuities), and beneficiary designations.
    2.1 Upon non-person entity selection, system transitions to organizational data capture
    2.2 When primary insured designation applies, system enables relationship auto-population from customer records

**3. Participant Search and Reuse**
User is able to search existing contacts and pre-populate demographic fields to maintain data consistency across policies.

**4. Data Quality Validation**
System enforces business rules including age boundaries, mandatory field completion, and cross-field dependencies before persistence.

**5. Inquiry Mode Protection**
When accessing records in view-only context, system disables all modification capabilities while maintaining full data visibility.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Mandatory Data Completion**
Given a participant setup workflow, When the user attempts submission with incomplete required fields, Then the system prevents progression and identifies missing data elements.

**2. Age Validation**
Given birth date entry, When the date exceeds 120 years in the past or represents a future date, Then the system rejects the input and requires correction.

**3. Product-Specific Field Adaptation**
Given a specific product line selection, When the participant record is accessed, Then the system displays only applicable demographic fields and enforces product-aligned validation rules.

**4. Non-Person Entity Handling**
Given a non-individual participant designation, When organizational entity is selected, Then the system hides personal identifiers and mandates business entity information.

**5. Data Synchronization**
Given successful participant data entry, When the record is saved, Then the system persists information consistently across Customer Entity Model and Policy Backend repositories.

#### Feature: Link policy participants to customer registry and maintain bidirectional synchronization
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: Link policy participants to the central customer registry and maintain bidirectional synchronization
- **Value**: Policy data remains consistent with enterprise customer records, eliminating duplicate entries and ensuring data accuracy across systems

So that **policy data remains consistent with enterprise customer records, eliminating duplicate entries and ensuring data accuracy across systems**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Policy Participant Data Submission**
User is able to submit policy participant information (Person, Legal Entity, Location, Vehicle) with optional registry identifier for synchronization processing.

**2. Intelligent Party Matching**
System attempts to match submitted attributes against existing registry records using uniqueness criteria to identify existing customer entries.

**3. Registry Record Management**
Upon successful match, system updates existing registry record with new relationships and attributes. When no match exists and data meets qualification standards, system creates new registry entry and returns identifier.

**4. Data Qualification Validation**
If submitted data fails qualification criteria, system prevents registry modification and notifies user of insufficient uniqueness information.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Successful Registry Link with Existing Record**

**2. New Registry Record Creation**
Given qualified participant data with no registry match, When user submits request without party identifier, Then system creates new registry entry and returns new identifier.

**3. Explicit Party Assignment**
Given user provides specific party identifier, When synchronization request is processed, Then system updates designated registry record regardless of attribute matching.

**4. Unqualified Data Rejection**
Given participant data lacks uniqueness qualification, When synchronization is attempted, Then system prevents registry modification and returns identification error message.

#### Feature: Apply relationship role mappings for dependent participants with primary insured reference
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: establish and maintain participant relationship hierarchies with reference to the primary insured
- **Value**: the customer enterprise model accurately reflects policy participant dependencies and enables downstream relationship-based business operations

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **establish and maintain participant relationship hierarchies with reference to the primary insured**,
So that **the customer enterprise model accurately reflects policy participant dependencies and enables downstream relationship-based business operations**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Relationship Source Identification**
System identifies eligible participants (Spouse Insured, Child Insured, Primary Beneficiary, Contingent Beneficiary) from policy records for relationship mapping. Other participant roles are excluded.

**2. Primary Insured Reference Establishment**
System designates Primary Insured as the target anchor point for all dependent participant relationships regardless of participant type or coverage association.

**3. Relationship Type Determination**
Upon processing participant data, system classifies relationship type based on participant nature: Personal for person-to-person (all insureds and person beneficiaries), OrgToInd for organization-to-individual beneficiaries.

**4. Relationship Role Mapping**
System transforms policy relationship codes to enterprise relationship roles, normalizing variant codes (OtherPerson/OtherNonPerson to Other) while validating against enterprise lookup standards.

**5. Multi-Coverage Relationship Consolidation**
When participants appear across multiple coverages with varying beneficiary designations, system consolidates relationships to Primary Insured without duplication.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Eligible Participant Processing**
Given policy contains multiple participants, When relationship mapping executes, Then only Spouse Insured, Child Insured, Primary Beneficiary, and Contingent Beneficiary roles are processed for enterprise relationship creation.

**2. Primary Insured Anchoring**
Given any eligible participant relationship, When establishing enterprise customer relationship, Then Primary Insured is always designated as the target reference point regardless of participant role or coverage type.

**3. Personal Relationship Type Assignment**
Given participant is an insured or person beneficiary, When determining relationship type, Then system assigns Personal classification and prevents non-person entity assignment for insured roles.

**4. Organization Beneficiary Handling**
Given beneficiary is a business or organization entity, When creating relationship, Then system assigns OrgToInd relationship type and links to Primary Insured individual customer.

**5. Relationship Code Normalization**
Given source relationship code is OtherPerson or OtherNonPerson, When mapping to enterprise model, Then system transforms code to Other and validates against enterprise relationship role standards.

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=828509548"
]

#### Feature: Validate Premium Calculations Against External Storage Baseline
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: validate premium calculations against external storage baseline to ensure accuracy and compliance
- **Value**: premium amounts are verified against authoritative external data sources, reducing financial discrepancies and ensuring regulatory compliance

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **validate premium calculations against external storage baseline to ensure accuracy and compliance**,
So that **premium amounts are verified against authoritative external data sources, reducing financial discrepancies and ensuring regulatory compliance**


**Key Capabilities:**

**Premium Calculation Initiation**
System triggers premium calculation process based on policy data and rating factors.

**External Baseline Retrieval**
System retrieves authoritative premium baseline from configured external storage repositories.

**Comparative Validation Execution**
System compares calculated premium against external baseline using defined tolerance thresholds.

**Discrepancy Resolution Workflow**
Upon detecting variance beyond tolerance, system flags calculation for review and applies configured business rules.
    4.1 When discrepancy is within acceptable range, system proceeds with calculated premium
    4.2 When discrepancy exceeds threshold, system escalates for manual adjudication

**Validation Results Recording**
System persists validation outcomes with audit trail for compliance reporting.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Successful Baseline Match**
Given premium calculation completes, When compared against external baseline with zero variance, Then system approves premium and proceeds with policy processing.

**Acceptable Variance Handling**
Given validation identifies minor discrepancy within tolerance, When business rules permit auto-adjustment, Then system applies correction and logs variance resolution.

**Excessive Variance Escalation**
Given calculated premium exceeds baseline by configured threshold, When validation fails, Then system prevents policy progression and routes to review queue.

**External System Unavailability**
Given external storage is inaccessible during validation, When baseline retrieval fails, Then system applies fallback procedures and notifies administrators.

**Audit Trail Completeness**
Given validation process executes, When results are recorded, Then system captures baseline source, variance amount, and resolution action for compliance reporting.


**Reference URLs:**

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=631140670"
]

#### Feature: Lookup and validate claim status across personal and commercial insurance products
- **Role**: Claims Administrator
- **Action**: lookup and validate claim status across personal and commercial insurance products through standardized lifecycle tracking
- **Value**: I can monitor claim progression, identify processing bottlenecks, and ensure accurate reporting across diverse product lines with consistent status definitions

**Description:**

As a **Claims Administrator**,
I want to **lookup and validate claim status across personal and commercial insurance products through standardized lifecycle tracking**,
So that **I can monitor claim progression, identify processing bottlenecks, and ensure accurate reporting across diverse product lines with consistent status definitions**


**Key Capabilities:**

**1. Claim Status Retrieval & Validation**
User is able to query claim records across personal and commercial products, retrieving current lifecycle position from 18 standardized status codes (ReceivedPendingActiveApprovedPaidClosed)

**2. Active Processing State Management**
When claim requires temporary suspension or inactivity designation, system transitions status appropriately while maintaining audit trail and enabling resumption

**3. Settlement & Negotiation Handling**
Upon parties agreeing to negotiated resolution, system records Compromised/Settled status and prevents further standard payment processing

**4. Rejection & Denial Processing**
If claim fails eligibility criteria or post-review validation, system assigns Disallowed or Denied status and terminates processing workflow

**5. Reopening & Rescission Management**
When previously closed claim requires reactivation or approved claim needs reversal, system supports Reopened and Rescinded statuses with appropriate downstream impacts


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**1. Multi-Product Status Consistency**
Given claims exist across personal auto and commercial fleet products, When administrator queries status for any claim, Then system returns standardized status code (0-17) with consistent business meaning regardless of product type

**2. Lifecycle Progression Validation**
Given claim in Active status, When payment processing completes successfully, Then system progresses through Base Cover Paid to Paid-in-Full to Closed statuses following standard lifecycle rules

**3. Exception Path Handling**
Given claim in Active processing state, When denial decision is made after full review, Then system transitions to Denied status and prevents further payment processing while maintaining complete audit history

**4. Suspended Payment Rules**
Given claim with Premium Payments Suspended status, When reinsurance calculations execute, Then reinsurance payments continue processing while coverage payments remain blocked per business rules

**5. Historical Status Retrieval**
Given driver record requires prior claims review in Commercial Fleet UI, Then system retrieves and displays all historical claim statuses with accurate lifecycle position for underwriting assessment


**Reference URLs:**

[
  "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=299372154"
]

**3. Quote Synchronization**
Given pending VS Individual Quotes exist, When Master Policy data changes, Then quotes are updated to reflect current Master Policy configuration before issuance

**4. Data Integrity Validation**
Given cascade execution completes, When system validates hierarchy consistency, Then all Member records pass data integrity checks or exceptions are logged

**5. Rollback on Failure**
Given cascade execution encounters critical errors, When validation fails, Then system rolls back partial changes and preserves pre-cascade state

#### Feature: Integrate external systems with Individual Life and Annuity policies to support underwriting questionnaire and premium calculation
- **Role**: Policy Administrator
- **Action**: configure and manage permanent life insurance products with integrated underwriting and premium calculation
- **Value**: customers receive appropriate coverage options with accurate pricing and streamlined underwriting aligned to their selected plan and face amount

**Description:**

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **configure and manage permanent life insurance products with integrated underwriting and premium calculation**,
So that **customers receive appropriate coverage options with accurate pricing and streamlined underwriting aligned to their selected plan and face amount**


**Key Capabilities:**

**Product Structure Configuration**
User is able to establish product packages with defined face amounts, mandatory base coverages, and optional/on-demand rider coverages according to plan specifications.

**Coverage Hierarchy Enforcement**
Upon coverage selection, system validates hierarchical dependencies ensuring mandatory parent coverages exist before allowing child coverages or sub-options to be added.

**Premium Calculation Integration**
When coverage selections are finalized, system invokes external premium calculation process to determine accurate pricing based on product type, face amount, and selected riders.

**Underwriting Questionnaire Processing**
User is able to initiate underwriting questionnaire workflow through integrated external system to assess risk and eligibility.

**Policy Issuance**
Upon successful underwriting and premium determination, system completes policy issuance with all configured coverages activated.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Valid Coverage Configuration**
Given a customer selects a product plan, When mandatory base coverage is present, Then system allows optional and on-demand coverages to be added per plan specifications.

**Hierarchical Dependency Validation**
Given a customer attempts to add sub-option coverage, When parent coverage does not exist, Then system prevents addition and requires parent coverage first.

**Premium Calculation Integration**
Given coverage selections are finalized, When premium calculation is initiated, Then system receives accurate pricing from external calculation system.

**Underwriting Integration**
Given customer information is complete, When underwriting questionnaire is triggered, Then system successfully transmits data to external underwriting system and receives eligibility determination.

**Policy Issuance Completion**
Given underwriting approval and premium determination are successful, When issuance is initiated, Then system creates policy with all configured coverages activated.
